concepts.label: Center symmetry
concepts.description: A higher-form global symmetry in gauge theories, typically one-form symmetries related to the center of the gauge group, which can be broken by extended objects like strings or domain walls.

concepts.label: Calabi-Yau compactification
concepts.description: Geometric compactification of extra dimensions using Kähler manifolds with vanishing first Chern class, preserving N=2 supersymmetry in four dimensions.

concepts.label: BPS states
concepts.description: Supersymmetric bound states saturating the Bogomolny bound; stable non-perturbative objects that preserve a fraction of supersymmetry and can carry charges under global symmetries.

concepts.label: Type IIA string theory
concepts.description: A ten-dimensional superstring theory with N=2 supersymmetry and both Ramond-Ramond and Neveu-Schwarz potentials, admitting compactifications to lower dimensions.

concepts.label: M-theory
concepts.description: Eleven-dimensional fundamental theory unifying all ten-dimensional superstring theories; compactification to lower dimensions yields effective supergravity coupled to matter.

concepts.label: Moduli space
concepts.description: The space of massless scalar fields parametrizing continuous deformations of the compactified geometry; includes Kähler and complex structure moduli.

concepts.label: Symmetry breaking
concepts.description: A phase transition or mechanism in which a global or gauge symmetry present in the Lagrangian is not respected by the vacuum state or physical spectrum.

concepts.label: Quantum gravity
concepts.description: The theoretical framework unifying quantum mechanics with general relativity; imposes constraints on effective field theories through consistency conditions like the Swampland.

concepts.label: Supergravity
concepts.description: A supersymmetric generalization of general relativity; the low-energy effective description of superstring theory and M-theory.

concepts.label: Vector multiplet
concepts.description: A supersymmetric representation containing a gauge field, gaugino fermions, and scalar components; couples to the graviton multiplet in supergravity.

concepts.label: Effective field theory
concepts.description: A systematic description of physics at scales well below the ultraviolet cutoff, obtained by integrating out heavy degrees of freedom.

concepts.label: Global symmetry breaking criterion
concepts.description: A quantitative measure proposed to evaluate the extent to which a global or higher-form symmetry is violated by non-perturbative effects in gravity theories.

concepts.label: Discrete symmetry
concepts.description: Finite group symmetries acting on geometric or field-theoretic objects that constrain physical interactions and particle spectra.

concepts.label: Mirror symmetry
concepts.description: Duality in string theory and geometry exchanging complex structure and Kähler moduli between dual CY pairs; also denotes parity-like symmetry in spacetime.

concepts.label: D₆ point group
concepts.description: Dihedral symmetry group of order 12 (isomorphic to Z₂ ⋊ Z₆) acting as the largest discrete automorphism on the GL=12 reflexive polytope.

concepts.label: Yukawa coupling
concepts.description: Trilinear coupling W_{ijk} = ∫ Ω ∧ ψᵢ ∧ ψⱼ ∧ ψₖ in the superpotential determined by CY geometry; governs fermion mass generation.

concepts.label: Flavor symmetry
concepts.description: Internal symmetry group acting on fermion generations to explain mass hierarchies and CKM/PMNS mixing angles.

concepts.label: Kähler moduli
concepts.description: Geometric moduli parameters τ parametrizing the Kähler cone of a CY threefold; dimensionally related to 4D scalar fields.

concepts.label: Complex structure moduli
concepts.description: Geometric parameters controlling the complex structure of a CY manifold; paired with Kähler moduli under mirror symmetry.

concepts.label: Reflexive polytope
concepts.description: Lattice polytope containing the origin in its interior such that its dual is also a lattice polytope; used to construct toric CY threefolds.

concepts.label: Del Pezzo divisor
concepts.description: A smooth rational surface of negative anti-canonical class appearing as a divisor in a CY threefold; supports non-perturbative instantons.

concepts.label: Non-perturbative instanton
concepts.description: Exponentially suppressed contributions to the superpotential from wrapped D3/E3-branes on divisors; generate forbidden Yukawa entries.

concepts.label: Large-volume scenario
concepts.description: String compactification regime in which some CY cycle volumes are exponentially large, stabilizing moduli and lowering the string scale.

concepts.label: Fermion mass hierarchy
concepts.description: The empirical fact that fermion masses span many orders of magnitude (e.g. top/electron ≈ 10⁵) unexplained in the SM without additional symmetry.

concepts.label: GUT unification
concepts.description: Grand unified symmetries (SU(5), SO(10), Pati-Salam) embedding the SM gauge group; often broken to SM by F-theory spectral cover.

concepts.label: Heterotic string
concepts.description: Superstring theory with E₈×E₈ or SO(32) gauge symmetry; naturally connects to CY compactification and mirror symmetry.

concepts.label: Lorentz violation
concepts.description: Explicit breaking of Lorentz invariance in a gravitational or field theory, leading to violation of diffeomorphism invariance.

concepts.label: diffeomorphism invariance
concepts.description: Invariance of a gravitational theory under smooth coordinate transformations; fundamental symmetry of general relativity.

concepts.label: local translations
concepts.description: Alternative symmetry transformations in first-order formalism of gravity theories that generalise diffeomorphisms and are Lorentz covariant off-shell.

concepts.label: first-order formalism
concepts.description: Reformulation of gravity using tetrads/vielbein and spin connections as independent variables instead of the metric.

concepts.label: Standard Model Extension
concepts.description: Effective field theory framework introducing Lorentz and CPT violation terms coupled to Standard Model fields.

concepts.label: minimal gravity sector
concepts.description: Subset of the Standard Model Extension containing only gravitational Lorentz-violating operators without matter coupling.

concepts.label: spontaneous Lorentz violation
concepts.description: Lorentz symmetry breaking induced by vacuum expectation values in a dynamical spacetime; regarded as more natural alternative to explicit violation.

concepts.label: spacetime dynamics
concepts.description: Regime in which the metric or geometric structure of spacetime is treated as dynamical variable subject to quantum fluctuations.

concepts.label: Lorentz covariance
concepts.description: Property of a theory or transformation that respects Lorentz group structure; transformations are off-shell Lorentz covariant if they preserve covariance before imposing equations of motion.

concepts.label: geometric gravity theory
concepts.description: Class of gravitational theories formulated on manifolds with geometric structures (metric, connection, torsion) as fundamental variables.

concepts.label: Wigner-Eckart theorem
concepts.description: Mathematical relation governing matrix elements of operators transforming under irreducible representations of a symmetry group.

concepts.label: Goldstone boson
concepts.description: Massless or light excitation arising from spontaneous breaking of a continuous global symmetry.

concepts.label: Ward identity
concepts.description: Constraint relation between correlation functions and matrix elements derived from symmetry invariance of the action.

concepts.label: irreducible representation
concepts.description: Representation of a symmetry group that cannot be decomposed into smaller invariant subrepresentations.

concepts.label: explicit symmetry breaking
concepts.description: Breaking of symmetry due to an explicit asymmetric term in the Hamiltonian rather than spontaneous symmetry breaking.

concepts.label: pseudo-Goldstone boson
concepts.description: Light boson arising from approximate symmetry breaking due to explicit but small symmetry-breaking terms in the Hamiltonian.

concepts.label: tadpole term
concepts.description: One-point correlation function or matrix element involving single-particle asymptotic states, related to symmetry breaking.

concepts.label: infinitely-extended system
concepts.description: Physical system with infinite volume limit where symmetry breaking and Goldstone bosons become well-defined.

concepts.label: symmetry group
concepts.description: Group of transformations under which a physical system or its Hamiltonian remains invariant.

concepts.label: matrix element
concepts.description: Expectation value or amplitude of an operator between two quantum states.

concepts.label: log Calabi-Yau compactification
concepts.description: A compactification of a Landau-Ginzburg model that produces a variety with logarithmic Calabi-Yau singularities at infinity.

concepts.label: Landau-Ginzburg model
concepts.description: A weak model consisting of a Fano variety paired with a holomorphic function, serving as a foundation for mirror symmetry constructions.

concepts.label: Fano variety
concepts.description: A smooth projective variety whose anticanonical bundle is ample; classified by positivity of the canonical divisor.

concepts.label: anticanonical system
concepts.description: The linear system of divisors in the anticanonical class −K_X, whose dimension constrains the geometry of a Fano variety.

concepts.label: singular fiber
concepts.description: A fiber of a morphism that contains singular points, arising over special values in the base.

concepts.label: fiber at infinity
concepts.description: The fiber of a compactified morphism over the point at infinity, encoding geometry lost in the affine model.

concepts.label: covering of projective space
concepts.description: A finite surjective morphism from a variety to projective space, typically classified by degree and index.

concepts.label: index of a variety
concepts.description: The positive integer index defined as the greatest common divisor of degrees of curves in the ample cone; index one means coprime.

concepts.label: smoothness obstruction
concepts.description: An obstruction preventing a singular variety from admitting a smooth desingularization or lift within a given family.

concepts.label: Hodge numbers
concepts.description: Topological invariants h^{p,q} measuring the dimension of Dolbeault cohomology groups; exchanged under mirror symmetry.

concepts.label: Metric fluctuations
concepts.description: Perturbative excitations of the spacetime metric tensor around a background geometry; describes graviton propagation.

concepts.label: Two-tensor coupling
concepts.description: Interaction term in the action between a rank-two tensor field and metric fluctuations; studied to cubic order in fields.

concepts.label: Conservation laws
concepts.description: Mathematical constraints derived from symmetries via Noether's theorem; restrict the form of allowed action terms.

concepts.label: Flat spacetime background
concepts.description: Minkowski metric η_μν; reference geometry around which metric and tensor field perturbations are expanded.

concepts.label: Cubic order expansion
concepts.description: Systematic enumeration of action terms containing products of three field fluctuation factors; captures nonlinear interactions.

concepts.label: Field decoupling
concepts.description: Reduction of a multi-field action to independent sectors with diagonal kinetic and interaction terms; typically possible only in special limits.

concepts.label: Quadratic action
concepts.description: Lagrangian density containing at most second-order products of field fluctuations; governs free-field dynamics and linearized equations.

concepts.label: Phenomenological calculations
concepts.description: Quantitative predictions from effective theories for observable processes; requires explicit form of action terms.

concepts.label: Calabi-Yau threefold
concepts.description: Complex threefold with trivial canonical bundle and Kähler metric, fundamental to string theory compactifications.

concepts.label: Hodge structure
concepts.description: Bigrading on cohomology compatible with Hodge operator; characterizes complex manifolds via h^{p,q} dimensions.

concepts.label: integral variation of Hodge structure
concepts.description: Family of Hodge structures parameterized over a base space, with integer periods satisfying Picard-Fuchs differential equations.

concepts.label: one-parameter family
concepts.description: Continuous deformation of geometric objects (e.g., CY threefolds) parameterized by a single variable.

concepts.label: thrice-punctured sphere
concepts.description: Riemann sphere with three punctures; moduli space P¹ minus three points, supporting one-parameter families with maximal monodromy.

concepts.label: h^{2,1} invariant
concepts.description: Hodge number counting (2,1) harmonic forms; measures complex structure deformations of CY threefolds.

concepts.label: geometric realization
concepts.description: Problem of constructing an explicit geometric object (e.g., CY family) whose periods match a given abstract Hodge structure or IVHS.

concepts.label: SYZ mirror symmetry
concepts.description: A geometric mirror symmetry construction for toric varieties via special Lagrangian fibrations, named after Strominger-Yau-Zaslow.

concepts.label: Toric Calabi-Yau
concepts.description: Calabi-Yau manifold admitting an action of a torus and described combinatorially by lattice polytopes; geometrically encoded by reflexive polytopes.

concepts.label: discrete torsion
concepts.description: Torsion cohomology class H ∈ H²(Γ, U(1)) in CY orbifold compactifications; shifts Yukawa selection rules.

concepts.label: Gorenstein index
concepts.description: Lattice-theoretic invariant of a reflexive polytope; the GL=12 polytope has Gorenstein index 12.

concepts.label: Poincaré symmetry
concepts.description: The spacetime symmetry group of special relativity combining Lorentz transformations and translations, forming the isometry group of Minkowski spacetime.

concepts.label: de Sitter symmetry
concepts.description: The quantum symmetry group of de Sitter spacetime with positive cosmological constant; Poincaré symmetry emerges as a degenerate limiting case.

concepts.label: anti-de Sitter algebra
concepts.description: The Lie algebra of symmetries in anti-de Sitter spacetime, characterized by representation operator eigenvalues that determine the transition to Poincaré limit.

concepts.label: de Sitter space
concepts.description: Classical spacetime with constant positive curvature and cosmological constant, whose quantum deformation limit reproduces Minkowski geometry.

concepts.label: Dirac singletons
concepts.description: Elementary representations of the anti-de Sitter algebra with lowest weight; bound states of two singletons yield massive particles in Minkowski limit.

concepts.label: quantum symmetry
concepts.description: Symmetry structure defined at the quantum level through representation operator eigenvalues and their algebraic properties, distinct from classical geometric symmetries.

concepts.label: representation operators
concepts.description: Operators implementing symmetry transformations in quantum theory; their eigenvalue spectrum determines the validity of approximate symmetries.

concepts.label: bound state formation
concepts.description: Mechanism where two or more elementary quantum objects combine to produce composite particles with distinct mass and quantum numbers.

concepts.label: Flato-Fronsdal approach
concepts.description: Framework treating standard elementary particles as bound states of Dirac singletons, providing a unified quantum picture of particle spectrum in de Sitter/AdS geometry.

concepts.label: approximate symmetry
concepts.description: A symmetry that holds with high but not perfect accuracy when parameters satisfy certain quantitative conditions; a limiting case of an exact symmetry.

concepts.label: cosmological constant
concepts.description: Energy density of the vacuum causing spacetime to curve; controls transition between de Sitter and Minkowski geometries through the radius parameter.

concepts.label: eigenvalue hierarchy
concepts.description: Separation of scales in representation operator spectra; when anti-de Sitter eigenvalues vastly exceed perturbative eigenvalues, Poincaré emerges as good approximation.

concepts.label: Lie point symmetries
concepts.description: Infinitesimal transformations that leave the geodesic equations invariant, generated by vector fields acting on the spacetime manifold.

concepts.label: geodesic equations
concepts.description: Differential equations describing the trajectories of free particles in a curved spacetime, parameterized by proper time or affine parameter.

concepts.label: projective collineations
concepts.description: Symmetries of spacetime that preserve the geodesic structure up to reparametrization, leaving the set of geodesics invariant.

concepts.label: decomposable spacetimes
concepts.description: Riemannian manifolds that admit a direct product structure, decomposing into lower-dimensional subspaces with product metric.

concepts.label: Riemannian geometry
concepts.description: Mathematical framework describing curved spaces with a metric tensor, enabling definition of distances, geodesics, and curvature.

concepts.label: collineations
concepts.description: Symmetries of spacetime that preserve the causal or geometric structure, including Killing vectors and conformal symmetries.

concepts.label: differential equations
concepts.description: Mathematical equations relating functions to their derivatives; fundamental for describing physical laws and dynamical systems.

concepts.label: subspace decomposition
concepts.description: Separation of a higher-dimensional manifold into direct product of lower-dimensional submanifolds with inherited metric structure.

concepts.label: affine parameter
concepts.description: Parameter along a geodesic curve such that the geodesic equation takes canonical form without parametrization-dependent terms.

concepts.label: vector fields
concepts.description: Smooth assignments of tangent vectors to each point on a manifold; generators of infinitesimal coordinate transformations.

concepts.label: Noether symmetry
concepts.description: A continuous symmetry of a physical system corresponding to a conserved quantity via the vanishing Lie derivative condition on the Lagrangian.

concepts.label: Lie derivative
concepts.description: A differential operator measuring how a tensor field changes along the flow of a vector field; the vanishing Lie derivative condition selects Noether symmetries.

concepts.label: Scalar-tensor gravity
concepts.description: A theory of gravitation coupling a scalar field to the metric tensor, extending general relativity with additional scalar degrees of freedom.

concepts.label: Gauss-Bonnet term
concepts.description: A topological invariant quadratic in curvature tensors that contributes to gravitational actions without affecting the classical equations of motion in 4D.

concepts.label: Canonical Lagrangian
concepts.description: A Lagrangian density formulated in canonical variables encoding the dynamics of a physical system.

concepts.label: First prolongation
concepts.description: An extension of a vector field to its derivatives; applied to the Noether vector to impose constraints on the infinitesimal generator.

concepts.label: Infinitesimal generator
concepts.description: A vector field whose flow generates a continuous symmetry transformation of the system.

concepts.label: Spacetime translation
concepts.description: A continuous symmetry transformation shifting coordinates; related to energy and momentum conservation via Noether's theorem.

concepts.label: Cosmological background
concepts.description: A spatially-flat or isotropic spacetime metric used in cosmology; typically assumed to be Friedmann-Lemaître-Robertson-Walker form.

concepts.label: Exact solution
concepts.description: An analytic solution to field equations obtained without approximation, often derived using symmetry reduction methods.

concepts.label: Symmetry reduction
concepts.description: A technique to lower the dimensionality or complexity of a dynamical system by exploiting conserved symmetries.

concepts.label: Scalar field coupling
concepts.description: An interaction term in the action between a scalar field and another field or geometric object such as the Gauss-Bonnet term.

concepts.label: asymptotic safety
concepts.description: Quantum gravity program proposing renormalizability through ultraviolet fixed points in metric-based gravitational couplings.

concepts.label: BRST symmetry
concepts.description: Gauge-fixing symmetry in quantum field theory ensuring consistency of covariant quantization and unitarity.

concepts.label: metric tensor
concepts.description: Fundamental geometric object in general relativity defining spacetime intervals and curvature; proposed as quantum degree of freedom in metric-based approaches.

concepts.label: ultraviolet fixed point
concepts.description: Scale-invariant coupling configuration in renormalization group flow at high energy scales, proposed as mechanism for quantum gravity renormalizability.

concepts.label: gauge parameter dependence
concepts.description: Unphysical variation of quantum results with arbitrary gauge-fixing choices, indicating gauge symmetry violation.

concepts.label: canonical quantization
concepts.description: Rigorous operator-based quantization scheme imposing equal-time commutation relations on classical phase space variables.

concepts.label: path integral
concepts.description: Functional integral formulation of quantum mechanics summing over all field configurations weighted by action; provides alternative to canonical quantization.

concepts.label: gravitational cutoff scale
concepts.description: Energy scale above which metric tensor ceases to be valid quantum degree of freedom in metric-based quantum gravity.

concepts.label: truncation scheme
concepts.description: Systematic approximation method in renormalization group calculations restricting functional space to subset of couplings.

concepts.label: unitarity
concepts.description: Fundamental quantum mechanical principle requiring probability conservation and absence of ghost instabilities in physical spectrum.

concepts.label: ghost instability
concepts.description: Pathological pole in quantum propagator with negative residue violating unitarity and indicating theory inconsistency.

concepts.label: Wick rotation
concepts.description: Analytic continuation from Euclidean to Minkowski spacetime enabling connection between Euclidean path integrals and Lorentzian correlation functions.

concepts.label: Emergent Gravity
concepts.description: Framework proposing gravity as emergent phenomenon from more fundamental quantum degrees of freedom rather than fundamental spacetime metric.

concepts.label: electroweak precision
concepts.description: Experimental measurements of weak interaction observables constraining quantum gravity and beyond-Standard-Model theories.

concepts.label: Hawking radiation
concepts.description: Thermal radiation emitted by black holes due to quantum effects near the event horizon, leading to black hole evaporation.

concepts.label: black hole thermodynamics
concepts.description: The study of black holes as thermodynamic systems with temperature, entropy, and radiation properties analogous to classical thermodynamics.

concepts.label: fermion emission
concepts.description: The process by which a black hole or quantum system emits fermionic particles such as electrons or quarks.

concepts.label: boson emission
concepts.description: The process by which a black hole or quantum system emits bosonic particles such as photons or gluons.

concepts.label: particle type selection
concepts.description: Mechanism determining whether emitted particles are fermionic or bosonic based on system parameters.

concepts.label: universality
concepts.description: The property that black hole evaporation exhibits the same characteristics regardless of the specific black hole properties or gravitational theory.

concepts.label: modified gravity
concepts.description: Theories that extend or alter general relativity, such as f(R) gravity, scalar-tensor theories, or other alternatives to Einstein's theory.

concepts.label: event horizon
concepts.description: The causal boundary of a black hole beyond which no information or particles can escape to infinity in classical general relativity.

concepts.label: quantum effects in curved spacetime
concepts.description: Quantum field theory phenomena occurring in the presence of strong gravitational fields and curved metric geometry.

concepts.label: free parameters
concepts.description: Tunable or adjustable parameters in a theoretical model that are not determined by the underlying symmetries or constraints.

concepts.label: noncritical string compactification
concepts.description: Compactification framework using higher-dimensional manifolds with quantized positive Ricci curvature that do not a priori describe consistent string vacua but can yield critical string spectra.

concepts.label: Ricci curvature
concepts.description: Geometric curvature invariant; manifolds with quantized positive Ricci curvature define the noncritical class studied in this framework.

concepts.label: exactly solvable models
concepts.description: Conformal field theories with exact solutions; the framework clarifies their relation to mean field theories and Calabi-Yau geometry.

concepts.label: Gepner model
concepts.description: Exactly solvable conformal field theory construction related to Calabi-Yau compactification; the noncritical framework modifies Gepner's conjecture.

concepts.label: mean field theory
concepts.description: Approximation scheme in quantum field theory; the framework clarifies the relation between exactly solvable models and their mean field limits in CY context.

concepts.label: massless spectrum
concepts.description: The set of massless particles arising from string compactification; noncritical manifolds can derive spectra matching critical string groundstates.

concepts.label: critical string theory
concepts.description: Superstring theory in 10 dimensions (or 26 for bosonic string); the framework derives critical spectra from higher-dimensional noncritical compactifications.

concepts.label: string compactification
concepts.description: Geometric construction reducing the dimensionality of spacetime by curling up extra dimensions on a compact manifold; central concept in string phenomenology.

concepts.label: rigid Calabi-Yau
concepts.description: A Calabi-Yau manifold with no Kähler deformations, i.e., zero antigenerations; the noncritical framework constructs their mirror partners.

concepts.label: string vacuum
concepts.description: A consistent background for critical string theory; noncritical manifolds with quantized Ricci curvature do not a priori describe vacua, yet yield consistent spectra.

concepts.label: Calabi-Yau metric
concepts.description: A Kähler metric with vanishing Ricci curvature on a Calabi-Yau manifold, satisfying the Ricci-flat condition.

concepts.label: maximal volume growth
concepts.description: The asymptotic behavior of a complete metric where the volume of balls grows polynomially at the fastest permitted rate by the geometry.

concepts.label: Calabi-Yau cone
concepts.description: A singular Calabi-Yau space with a conical singularity at the apex, characterized by a smooth Kähler-Einstein cross-section.

concepts.label: tangent cone at infinity
concepts.description: The limiting cone geometry obtained by rescaling a complete metric at arbitrarily large distance, describing the asymptotic shape of the space.

concepts.label: weighted blow-up
concepts.description: A generalization of the standard blow-up operation for manifolds with corners, used to compactify and resolve geometry at infinity.

concepts.label: manifold with corners
concepts.description: A topological space locally modeled on [0,∞)^k × ℝ^{n-k}, allowing controlled singularities and boundary structure.

concepts.label: weighted Hölder spaces
concepts.description: Function spaces equipped with norms involving weight functions and Hölder continuity conditions, adapted to weighted geometries.

concepts.label: Laplacian mapping properties
concepts.description: Regularity and solvability results for the Laplace operator between weighted Hölder spaces on singular or non-compact geometries.

concepts.label: transition behavior
concepts.description: A continuous deformation or interpolation between metrics with different tangent cone structures, exhibiting cone transitions.

concepts.label: Cartesian product
concepts.description: The direct product of two or more Calabi-Yau cones or spaces, combined with smoothing operations.

concepts.label: exact Kähler form
concepts.description: A Kähler form ω that is closed and globally exact, i.e., ω = dd^c f for some real function f.

concepts.label: complete metric
concepts.description: A Riemannian metric for which every Cauchy sequence converges, ensuring the underlying space is geodesically complete.

concepts.label: Klein-Gordon-Fock equation
concepts.description: Relativistic wave equation governing scalar field dynamics; fundamental equation for spin-0 particles in curved spacetime.

concepts.label: Hamilton-Jacobi equation
concepts.description: First-order partial differential equation for the action function; generates classical trajectories via canonical transformation.

concepts.label: symmetry operators
concepts.description: Differential operators commuting with the wave equation; generate conserved quantities and reduce complexity.

concepts.label: motion integrals
concepts.description: Conservation laws arising from symmetries; operators whose expectation values remain constant along solutions.

concepts.label: null hypersurface
concepts.description: Submanifold where the metric is degenerate; characteristic surface of hyperbolic equations with light-like normal.

concepts.label: transitive action
concepts.description: Group action such that any two points can be mapped to each other; orbit is the entire manifold.

concepts.label: electromagnetic field
concepts.description: Gauge field coupling minimally to charged particles; specified by field tensor F_μν in relativistic theory.

concepts.label: admissible electromagnetic field
concepts.description: Electromagnetic field configuration preserving the algebra structure of symmetry operators in the wave equation.

concepts.label: operator algebra
concepts.description: Algebraic structure of commutators and anticommutators among symmetry generators; encodes representation theory.

concepts.label: charged test particle
concepts.description: Point particle with charge q moving in external EM field; trajectory determined by Lorentz force.

concepts.label: spacetime manifold
concepts.description: 4-dimensional Riemannian or pseudo-Riemannian manifold with metric structure encoding gravitational geometry.

concepts.label: crystalline cohomology
concepts.description: A Weil cohomology theory for algebraic varieties in characteristic p>0 that provides p-adic analogues of singular cohomology.

concepts.label: ordinary Calabi-Yau
concepts.description: A Calabi-Yau variety in positive characteristic p whose crystalline cohomology exhibits maximal Frobenius-split structure analogous to complex CY near boundary moduli.

concepts.label: prepotential
concepts.description: A generating function encoding the effective action in N=2 supersymmetric theories, whose second derivatives yield Yukawa couplings near special geometry points.

concepts.label: maximal unipotent monodromy
concepts.description: Local monodromy structure at the boundary of moduli space where the Picard-Fuchs differential equation has maximal unipotent monodromic action.

concepts.label: canonical coordinates
concepts.description: Special coordinates on the moduli space of CY manifolds, analogous to flat coordinates in special geometry, satisfying integrality and modular properties.

concepts.label: p-adic integrality
concepts.description: Arithmetic property of canonical coordinates and prepotential in characteristic p, analogous to integral monodromy and modular forms in complex geometry.

concepts.label: Thirring model
concepts.description: A relativistic fermionic field theory with four-fermion interactions exhibiting asymptotic safety in three spacetime dimensions.

concepts.label: critical flavor number
concepts.description: The threshold number of fermion flavors separating a phase with spontaneous symmetry breaking from a symmetric phase in the Thirring model.

concepts.label: phase transition
concepts.description: A qualitative change in the physical state of a system marked by discontinuity or singularity in thermodynamic or order-parameter properties.

concepts.label: chiral fermions
concepts.description: Lattice fermion formulation (such as SLAC or overlap fermions) that preserves exact chiral symmetry at finite lattice spacing.

concepts.label: order parameter
concepts.description: A scalar quantity that vanishes in the symmetric phase and acquires a non-zero expectation value in a symmetry-broken phase, characterizing the phase transition.

concepts.label: Dirac materials
concepts.description: Condensed matter systems with linear dispersion relation near the Fermi surface, described by relativistic Dirac fermion theories.

concepts.label: four-component flavor
concepts.description: A classification of fermion representations in lattice field theory; reducible or irreducible flavor multiplets differing in their symmetry properties under the flavor group.

concepts.label: critical exponent
concepts.description: Universal power-law exponent characterizing the divergence of correlation length or scaling of observables near a continuous phase transition.

concepts.label: phase transition without order parameter
concepts.description: A continuous topological or non-conventional phase transition undetectable by local order parameters but signaled by singularities in higher-order response or entanglement properties.

concepts.label: lattice fermion formulation
concepts.description: Discretization scheme for fermion fields on a spacetime lattice, incorporating correct symmetry and dispersion properties relevant to continuum limits.

concepts.label: multi-flavor Fermi systems
concepts.description: Field theories of multiple interacting fermion species coupled by flavor-symmetric interactions in arbitrary spacetime dimensions.

concepts.label: continuum limit
concepts.description: The limit in which lattice spacing vanishes, recovering the continuum quantum field theory from its lattice regularization.

concepts.label: baryogenesis
concepts.description: Physical process generating the observed baryon asymmetry in the primordial Universe during its early stages.

concepts.label: Sakharov criteria
concepts.description: Three necessary conditions for baryogenesis: baryon number violation, C and CP violation, and departure from thermal equilibrium.

concepts.label: baryon number violation
concepts.description: Process by which the total baryon number of a system changes, required for net baryon asymmetry production.

concepts.label: CP violation
concepts.description: Asymmetry between the behaviour of matter and antimatter under combined charge conjugation and parity transformations.

concepts.label: thermal equilibrium departure
concepts.description: Deviation from thermal equilibrium conditions necessary to prevent particle-antiparticle equilibration.

concepts.label: electroweak baryogenesis
concepts.description: Baryogenesis mechanism occurring during the electroweak phase transition in the early Universe.

concepts.label: Grand Unification Theories baryogenesis
concepts.description: Baryogenesis mechanism operating within Grand Unified Theory frameworks, typically at higher energy scales.

concepts.label: time-temperature relation
concepts.description: Cosmological relationship between cosmic time and temperature evolution in the expanding Universe.

concepts.label: interaction rates
concepts.description: Rates of microscopic processes generating baryon asymmetry in the early Universe.

concepts.label: cosmic expansion rate
concepts.description: Rate of spacetime expansion quantified by the Hubble parameter in cosmological models.

concepts.label: modified gravity theories
concepts.description: Extensions of General Relativity that alter the gravitational dynamics and cosmological evolution.

concepts.label: primordial Universe
concepts.description: The earliest stages of cosmic history immediately following the Big Bang.

concepts.label: Type IIB string theory
concepts.description: Ten-dimensional superstring theory with two identical left-moving and right-moving supersymmetries, compactified on CY3 to produce four-dimensional effective theories.

concepts.label: cohomology torsion
concepts.description: Torsion classes in de Rham cohomology of the CY3, characterised by finite order elements in cohomology groups.

concepts.label: cup product
concepts.description: Multiplicative structure on cohomology mapping second cohomology elements to higher degree cohomology classes.

concepts.label: Heisenberg-type group
concepts.description: Non-abelian discrete symmetry group with Heisenberg algebra structure, generated by torsion cup products in cohomology.

concepts.label: elliptic curve product
concepts.description: Geometry constructed as a product of three elliptic curves E×E×E, serving as base space for CY construction by discrete quotient.

concepts.label: fixed-point-free action
concepts.description: Action of a discrete group (Z₂ × Z₂) on a manifold with no fixed points, used to construct smooth quotient CY geometries.

concepts.label: four-dimensional effective theory
concepts.description: Low-energy effective field theory resulting from compactification of ten-dimensional string theory on CY3.

concepts.label: Non-Linear Sigma Model
concepts.description: A quantum field theory defined on a curved target manifold where scalar fields take values in a homogeneous space, with symmetry non-linearly realized.

concepts.label: Local Functional Equation
concepts.description: A cohomological constraint encoding the invariance of the SU(2) Haar measure under local left transformations, used to classify quantum divergences.

concepts.label: SU(2) Haar measure
concepts.description: The invariant measure on the SU(2) Lie group preserved under local left-multiplication symmetry transformations.

concepts.label: One-particle irreducible amplitudes
concepts.description: Connected Feynman diagrams with no internal propagators cut that cannot be separated into disconnected pieces; include both on-shell and off-shell contributions.

concepts.label: Quantum divergences
concepts.description: Ultraviolet infinities appearing in loop integrals of quantum field theory amplitudes that require renormalization.

concepts.label: Cohomological methods
concepts.description: Mathematical tools from cohomology theory used to systematically classify and analyze quantum symmetry deformations and anomalies.

concepts.label: Nonlinearly realized symmetry
concepts.description: A global symmetry where the fields transform in a nonlinear fashion, typically on a homogeneous space quotient G/H.

concepts.label: Yang-Mills theory
concepts.description: A gauge theory based on a non-abelian Lie group with applications to nuclear and particle physics.

concepts.label: Electroweak theory
concepts.description: Unified quantum field theory of electromagnetic and weak interactions via the SU(2)×U(1) gauge group with Higgs mechanism.

concepts.label: LHC data
concepts.description: Experimental measurements from the Large Hadron Collider used to test predictions of fundamental physics theories.

concepts.label: Symmetric subtraction
concepts.description: A renormalization scheme that removes ultraviolet divergences while preserving the underlying gauge or global symmetries of the theory.

concepts.label: Homogeneous space
concepts.description: A smooth manifold with a transitive action of a Lie group, typically expressed as a quotient G/H of two Lie groups.

concepts.label: Briggs-Rauscher oscillation
concepts.description: A chemical oscillatory reaction involving iodide, iodate, and hydrogen peroxide that exhibits periodic color changes between colorless and dark blue states.

concepts.label: Crazy-clock phenomenon
concepts.description: An unexpected transition in the Briggs-Rauscher reaction where the system abruptly switches from low iodide/iodine concentration (state I) to high concentration with a new iodine phase (state II).

concepts.label: Chemical oscillation
concepts.description: Temporal periodic variation in chemical concentrations or observable properties in a chemical system far from equilibrium.

concepts.label: Iodide concentration
concepts.description: The molar concentration of iodide ions in the Briggs-Rauscher system, which varies periodically and characterizes the oscillatory state.

concepts.label: Iodine phase
concepts.description: A distinct physical or chemical phase of iodine that emerges in the high-concentration state II of the crazy-clock transition.

concepts.label: Mixing rate
concepts.description: The stirring or agitation speed that controls convective mixing in the Briggs-Rauscher system and influences transition dynamics.

concepts.label: Cluster analysis
concepts.description: A statistical method (K-means) used to identify time-domains where transitions are more likely to occur by grouping experimental observations.

concepts.label: Nonlinear chemical dynamics
concepts.description: The study of time-dependent behavior in chemical systems exhibiting nonlinear kinetics, far-from-equilibrium phenomena, and complex temporal patterns.

concepts.label: Intrinsic randomness
concepts.description: Inherent stochastic variability in a chemical system's response that cannot be attributed to experimental noise, producing unpredictable transition timing.

concepts.label: Magnetic stirring
concepts.description: A mixing technique using a magnetic bar and external magnetic field to agitate the reaction mixture in a controlled manner.

concepts.label: Lorentz group
concepts.description: The group of linear transformations preserving the Minkowski metric, forming the foundation of special relativity.

concepts.label: Poincaré sphere
concepts.description: A geometric representation of the polarization states of light on a unit sphere, where antipodal points represent orthogonal polarizations.

concepts.label: Wigner little group
concepts.description: The subgroup of the Lorentz group that leaves a four-momentum invariant, characterizing internal space-time symmetries for particles.

concepts.label: two-by-two representation
concepts.description: Matrix representation of the Lorentz group using 2×2 complex matrices, providing a spinorial description of Lorentz transformations.

concepts.label: polarization optics
concepts.description: The study of the polarization states and transformations of electromagnetic waves.

concepts.label: particle mass
concepts.description: A Lorentz-invariant quantity characterizing the rest energy of a particle.

concepts.label: decoherence mechanism
concepts.description: The process by which quantum systems lose coherence due to interaction with the environment, leading to classical behavior.

concepts.label: Minkowski spacetime
concepts.description: The four-dimensional space-time with the Minkowski metric, providing the geometric framework for special relativity.

concepts.label: NS flux
concepts.description: Neveu-Schwarz three-form background flux in type II string theory compactifications; induces generalized complex geometry.

concepts.label: half-flat manifold
concepts.description: Six-dimensional manifold with SU(3) structure that is neither complex nor Ricci-flat; arises as mirror of fluxed Calabi-Yau.

concepts.label: SU(3) structure
concepts.description: Geometric structure on six-dimensional manifold defined by a pair of differential forms (J, Ω); generalizes Kähler and complex geometry.

concepts.label: low-energy effective action
concepts.description: Four-dimensional supergravity action resulting from string theory compactification; encodes physics below string scale.

concepts.label: holonomy group
concepts.description: Lie group of parallel transports around closed loops on a manifold; classifies geometric structure.

concepts.label: generalized complex geometry
concepts.description: Extension of complex and symplectic geometry via differential forms and Courant bracket; naturally incorporates fluxes.

concepts.label: Lie point symmetry
concepts.description: A continuous transformation of coordinates and fields that leaves the equations of motion invariant; generalises Noether symmetries.

concepts.label: Modified Gauss-Bonnet gravity
concepts.description: Extended gravitational theory with action depending on both Ricci scalar R and Gauss-Bonnet invariant G, with arbitrary functional form f(R,G).

concepts.label: Ricci scalar
concepts.description: Contraction of the Ricci curvature tensor R; fundamental scalar invariant in general relativity and modified gravity theories.

concepts.label: Spherically symmetric solution
concepts.description: Exact solution of gravitational field equations invariant under the rotation group SO(3); characterized by metric functions of radial coordinate only.

concepts.label: Gravitational theory selection
concepts.description: Procedure for identifying viable modified gravity models using geometric or symmetry-based criteria among the infinite landscape of possible extensions to general relativity.

concepts.label: Invariant quantity
concepts.description: Observable or geometric property that remains unchanged under a specified group of transformations; central to understanding solution structure.

concepts.label: special Lagrangian fibration
concepts.description: A fibration of a Calabi-Yau 3-fold by special Lagrangian 3-folds, proposed in SYZ to relate mirror pairs via dual torus fibrations.

concepts.label: Tyurin degeneration
concepts.description: A special type of degenerative limit of Calabi-Yau manifolds where generic fibers remain Calabi-Yau and central fiber is a union of simpler components.

concepts.label: Doran-Harder-Thompson conjecture
concepts.description: Conjecture relating mirror symmetry for Calabi-Yau manifolds to that for quasi-Fano varieties via Tyurin degenerations.

concepts.label: quasi-Fano manifold
concepts.description: A smooth projective variety with ample anti-canonical divisor; the boundary case of Fano geometry relevant to mirror symmetry.

concepts.label: theta function
concepts.description: Holomorphic function on complex tori that arises in the geometric quantization of Lagrangian fibrations and mirror symmetry.

concepts.label: geometric quantization
concepts.description: Method to construct quantum mechanics from classical phase space geometry; used to interpret mirror symmetry as quantization.

concepts.label: Orbifold quotient
concepts.description: CY manifold obtained by modding out a parent CY by a finite group Γ ⊂ SU(3), introducing discrete torsion and altering Yukawa selection rules.

concepts.label: syzygetic structure
concepts.description: The module of syzygies (relations among generators) of a graded ring or ideal, encoding implicit equations.

concepts.label: projection
concepts.description: A linear or rational map from a variety to projective space, often via a projection center outside the variety.

concepts.label: singular Calabi-Yau
concepts.description: A Calabi-Yau variety with canonical singularities (not smooth), often obtained as a hypersurface in weighted projective space.

concepts.label: smoothing
concepts.description: A deformation of a singular variety to a smooth one, typically via versal deformation or resolution.

concepts.label: Picard group
concepts.description: The group of Weil divisor classes modulo linear equivalence; Picard rank is the dimension of its image under the Chern class map.

concepts.label: primitive contraction
concepts.description: An extremal contraction in the Mori program that contracts a single extremal ray; classified by the structure of the exceptional divisor.

concepts.label: exceptional divisor
concepts.description: A divisor contracted to a subvariety of lower dimension under a birational map; its structure encodes the singularity type.

concepts.label: blow-up
concepts.description: The birational inverse of a contraction; resolves a point singularity by replacing it with a projective space.

concepts.label: projective plane
concepts.description: The two-dimensional projective space ℙ², the space of lines through the origin in k³.

concepts.label: Picard rank one
concepts.description: A variety whose Picard group is isomorphic to ℤ, meaning all divisors are generated by a single ample line bundle.

concepts.label: type II contraction
concepts.description: A divisorial contraction whose exceptional divisor is a ruled surface (or generalisation); classified in the Mori program.

concepts.label: canonical singularity
concepts.description: A singularity for which the discrepancy coefficients in the resolution are non-negative; central to the minimal model program.

concepts.label: twisted Calabi-Yau algebra
concepts.description: A noncommutative algebra satisfying a twisted version of Calabi-Yau duality, generalizing the geometric Calabi-Yau condition to the algebraic setting.

concepts.label: graded algebra
concepts.description: An algebra with a direct sum decomposition by degree, where multiplication respects the grading structure.

concepts.label: Artin-Schelter regularity
concepts.description: A homological regularity condition for noncommutative algebras analogous to polynomial rings, characterizing smoothness in noncommutative geometry.

concepts.label: locally finite-dimensional algebra
concepts.description: An algebra where each homogeneous component has finite dimension as a vector space.

concepts.label: separable algebra
concepts.description: An algebra that remains semisimple after any field extension; equivalently, projective as a bimodule over itself.

concepts.label: graded radical
concepts.description: The Jacobson radical of a graded algebra, consisting of elements annihilating all graded simple modules.

concepts.label: GK dimension
concepts.description: Gelfand-Kirillov dimension; a growth invariant measuring the polynomial growth rate of generating sets in a noncommutative algebra.

concepts.label: noetherian algebra
concepts.description: An algebra satisfying the ascending chain condition on left (or right) ideals, ensuring finiteness properties.

concepts.label: invertible bimodule
concepts.description: A bimodule M over an algebra A such that there exists a bimodule N with M ⊗_A N ≅ A ≅ N ⊗_A M, generalizing invertible modules.

concepts.label: tensor algebra
concepts.description: The free algebra generated by a bimodule M over a base algebra, constructed as ⊕_{n≥0} M^{⊗_A n}.

concepts.label: dimension (algebra)
concepts.description: A categorical invariant for graded algebras (dim 0, 1, 2, etc.) reflecting the complexity of the algebra's structure.

concepts.label: homological regularity
concepts.description: A property of algebras defined by vanishing or controlled behavior of Ext and Tor groups, generalizing polynomial smoothness.

concepts.label: Calabi conjecture
concepts.description: Yau's theorem establishing existence of Kähler-Einstein metrics on Fano varieties and constant scalar curvature metrics on Kähler manifolds with vanishing first Chern class.

concepts.label: Kähler structure
concepts.description: Symplectic structure on a complex manifold compatible with the complex structure, characterized by a closed (1,1)-form.

concepts.label: complex structure
concepts.description: The specification of holomorphic coordinates and transition functions defining the complex manifold.

concepts.label: complex Monge-Ampère equation
concepts.description: Nonlinear PDE governing deformations of Kähler metrics: (∂∂̄φ)ⁿ = ρ, central to Yau's proof of Calabi conjecture.

concepts.label: modularity
concepts.description: Property that the L-function or zeta function of a geometric object equals that of an automorphic form, linking geometry to representation theory.

concepts.label: good reduction
concepts.description: Property of a variety defined over Q that its reduction modulo a prime p remains smooth and non-singular.

concepts.label: Hodge number
concepts.description: Topological invariant h^{p,q} characterizing the Dolbeault cohomology of a Calabi-Yau; h¹¹ counts complex structure moduli.

concepts.label: generalized Calabi-Yau
concepts.description: Extension of the classical Calabi-Yau structure, generalizing the geometric framework to broader classes of complex manifolds.

concepts.label: Duistermaat-Heckman formula
concepts.description: Equivariant integration formula computing the Duistermaat-Heckman measure for a torus action on a symplectic or Kähler manifold.

concepts.label: torus action
concepts.description: Action of a torus group T^n on a manifold preserving the geometric structure and enabling localization techniques.

concepts.label: localization formula
concepts.description: Mathematical technique reducing equivariant integrals to contributions from fixed point sets under group actions.

concepts.label: Hamiltonian action
concepts.description: Action of a Lie group on a symplectic manifold that preserves the symplectic structure and admits moment maps.

concepts.label: Duistermaat-Heckman measure
concepts.description: Probability measure on the image of the moment map defined by equivariant integration over a symplectic manifold.

concepts.label: piecewise polynomial density
concepts.description: Density function of the Duistermaat-Heckman measure which is piecewise polynomial on the moment polytope.

concepts.label: fixed point set
concepts.description: Subset of a manifold invariant under a group action; critical for evaluating localization formulas.

concepts.label: equivariant cohomology
concepts.description: Cohomology theory incorporating the action of a group, providing algebraic tools for computing localization formulas.

concepts.label: moment polytope
concepts.description: Convex polytope which is the image of the moment map for a Hamiltonian torus action on a compact manifold.

concepts.label: Tian-Todorov Theorem
concepts.description: Classical result establishing that deformations of Calabi-Yau manifolds are unobstructed, meaning all infinitesimal deformations extend to global deformations.

concepts.label: line bundle
concepts.description: A rank-1 holomorphic vector bundle on a complex manifold, characterized by its first Chern class.

concepts.label: deformation theory
concepts.description: The mathematical framework studying how geometric structures vary under infinitesimal perturbations and whether obstructions prevent extensions to global deformations.

concepts.label: Calabi-Yau operator
concepts.description: A Fuchsian differential operator that determines Q-local systems underlying a Q-VHS with specific Hodge numbers and encodes geometric data of mirror Calabi-Yau threefolds.

concepts.label: Fuchsian differential operator
concepts.description: A linear differential equation with regular singular points, whose solutions encode topological and arithmetic data of algebraic varieties.

concepts.label: Picard-Fuchs operator
concepts.description: A differential operator satisfied by periods of a family of algebraic varieties; encodes moduli dependence of cohomology.

concepts.label: Q-local system
concepts.description: A locally constant sheaf of Q-vector spaces with monodromy representation around singular points.

concepts.label: Rational curves
concepts.description: Algebraic curves of genus zero embedded in algebraic varieties; their counts encode enumerative invariants.

concepts.label: pre-Calabi-Yau category
concepts.description: A differential graded category equipped with a cyclic A-infinity structure satisfying Calabi-Yau duality conditions.

concepts.label: homotopy transfer theorem
concepts.description: A fundamental result establishing that algebraic structures transfer along homotopy equivalences, preserving key properties.

concepts.label: minimal model
concepts.description: A cofibrant replacement of a dg category with zero differentials on generators, capturing the homotopy type.

concepts.label: dg quiver
concepts.description: A directed graph with differential graded structure on path algebras, allowing degree shifts and differentials on arrows.

concepts.label: quasi-isomorphism
concepts.description: A morphism of dg categories inducing an isomorphism on homology in all degrees.

concepts.label: Calabi-Yau duality
concepts.description: A cyclic symmetry property of Hochschild homology and cohomology with degree shift, expressing non-commutative geometry Poincaré duality.

concepts.label: pre-Calabi-Yau morphism
concepts.description: A dg functor between pre-Calabi-Yau categories that respects the cyclic A-infinity structure and Calabi-Yau duality.

concepts.label: A-infinity structure
concepts.description: A weakly associative algebraic structure with higher associativity homotopies, generalising associative algebras.

concepts.label: differential graded category
concepts.description: A category whose morphism spaces are chain complexes and composition respects differential structure.

concepts.label: Hochschild homology
concepts.description: A derived functor measuring self-extensions in algebra, computed as homology of the Hochschild complex.

concepts.label: cyclic structure
concepts.description: A higher algebraic structure encoding cyclic symmetries on bimodules or cochains, extending A-infinity to A-cyclic algebras.

concepts.label: quasi-inverse
concepts.description: A morphism that is a two-sided homotopy inverse in the homotopy category, not necessarily a strict categorical inverse.

concepts.label: log Calabi-Yau pair
concepts.description: A pair (X, B) where X is a normal variety and B is a divisor such that K_X + B is numerically equivalent to zero, generalizing Calabi-Yau geometry to allow mild singularities.

concepts.label: coregularity
concepts.description: A measure of the complexity of singularities in log pairs; coregularity zero corresponds to the simplest singularity structure in the Minimal Model Program.

concepts.label: index
concepts.description: The smallest positive integer m such that mK_X is Cartier; bounds growth of the index as dimension increases.

concepts.label: Weil index
concepts.description: An invariant measuring the divisibility of the canonical class in the Weil divisor group; related to the index through resolution of singularities.

concepts.label: klt Calabi-Yau variety
concepts.description: A Kawamata log terminal Calabi-Yau variety where the index can grow doubly exponentially with dimension, in contrast to coregularity-zero log pairs.

concepts.label: generalized log Calabi-Yau pair
concepts.description: An extension of log Calabi-Yau pairs allowing more general singularity types while preserving the numerically trivial canonical class condition.

concepts.label: semi-log canonical pair
concepts.description: A pair with singularities more general than log canonical, intermediate between lc and purely reducible singularities.

concepts.label: isolated log canonical singularity
concepts.description: A log canonical singularity at a single point of a variety, studied via local index bounds under coregularity-zero constraints.

concepts.label: Gross-Siebert program
concepts.description: A framework for constructing mirror Calabi-Yau varieties via toric degeneration and tropical geometry; imposes index bounds through degenerations.

concepts.label: Kontsevich-Soibelman program
concepts.description: A foundational approach to mirror symmetry via non-commutative geometry and stability conditions; constrains the index of CY varieties in degenerations.

concepts.label: finite group action
concepts.description: An action of a discrete group Γ on a Calabi-Yau variety, relevant for discrete symmetry and orbifold quotients.

concepts.label: holomorphic symplectic variety
concepts.description: A simply-connected Kähler variety with a holomorphic symplectic form; studied with purely non-symplectic automorphisms.

concepts.label: purely non-symplectic automorphism
concepts.description: An automorphism of a holomorphic symplectic variety that acts trivially on the symplectic form; constrains the index via coregularity analysis.

concepts.label: Minimal Model Program
concepts.description: A systematic approach to classifying varieties via birational geometry, producing singularities classified by log discrepancy and coregularity.

concepts.label: Borcea-Voisin duality
concepts.description: Cohomological mirror symmetry construction for Calabi-Yau varieties defined by involutions, generalizable across dimensions and factor structures.

concepts.label: Berglund-Hübsch duality
concepts.description: Mirror symmetry for hypersurfaces in weighted projective spaces constructed via quotient by abelian group actions on polynomial equations.

concepts.label: Landau-Ginzburg/Calabi-Yau correspondence
concepts.description: Equivalence relating Landau-Ginzburg orbifold models to Calabi-Yau orbifolds via conformal field theory and cohomological methods.

concepts.label: involution
concepts.description: Order-2 automorphism acting on a variety; when volume-form-preserving defines a Calabi-Yau orbifold; when non-preserving enables semi-CY structures.

concepts.label: volume form
concepts.description: Holomorphic top-degree differential; preservation under group action is necessary for standard Calabi-Yau geometry but relaxed in semi-CY setting.

concepts.label: hypersurface of general type
concepts.description: Algebraic variety with negative first Chern class; generic loci of involution fixed-sets in semi-CY geometry, extending beyond Calabi-Yau.

concepts.label: semi-Calabi-Yau
concepts.description: Orbifold geometry obtained by quotienting by involution that does not preserve the volume form, intermediate between Calabi-Yau and general-type varieties.

concepts.label: orbifold cohomology
concepts.description: Cohomological theory adapted to orbifold singularities, incorporating twisted sectors and discrete torsion contributions.

concepts.label: special Lagrangian submanifold
concepts.description: A real m-dimensional submanifold of a Calabi-Yau m-fold that is calibrated by the real part of the holomorphic volume form, minimizing volume in its homology class.

concepts.label: calibrated geometry
concepts.description: The theory of submanifolds defined by closure of a differential form (calibration), which characterize minimal submanifolds in Riemannian geometry.

concepts.label: SYZ Conjecture
concepts.description: A conjecture by Strominger-Yau-Zaslow explaining mirror symmetry via special Lagrangian fibrations: mirror pairs are dual tori over the same base.

concepts.label: singularities of special Lagrangian
concepts.description: Isolated or continuous singular points on special Lagrangian submanifolds, often modelled locally on cones, with implications for mirror symmetry.

concepts.label: almost Calabi-Yau manifold
concepts.description: A generalization of Calabi-Yau manifolds with a closed non-degenerate (m,0)-form, used as a technical tool in special Lagrangian geometry.

concepts.label: Calabi-Yau caps
concepts.description: Symplectic manifolds with vanishing first Chern class used to construct obstructions to exact fillings of contact manifolds.

concepts.label: exact fillings
concepts.description: Exact symplectic fillings of contact manifolds whose boundary is a given contact 3-manifold.

concepts.label: contact 3-manifold
concepts.description: A 3-dimensional manifold equipped with a contact structure (a maximally non-integrable hyperplane distribution).

concepts.label: cotangent bundle
concepts.description: The bundle of cotangent vectors over a manifold; its unit cotangent bundle carries a canonical contact structure.

concepts.label: first Chern class
concepts.description: A topological invariant c₁ measuring the first Chern class of a complex vector bundle or symplectic manifold.

concepts.label: symplectic uniruled caps
concepts.description: Symplectic manifolds with uniruled geometry used as obstructions to fillings; generalise CY caps via adjunction inequality.

concepts.label: strong fillings
concepts.description: Symplectic fillings that admit a convex boundary and satisfy positivity conditions on the contact structure.

concepts.label: disk cotangent bundle
concepts.description: The bundle of covectors with norm ≤1 over a base manifold; a standard model for exact fillings.

concepts.label: Stein fillable contact
concepts.description: A contact structure admitting a Stein manifold as an exact filling; related to the existence of plurisubharmonic functions.

concepts.label: topological invariants
concepts.description: Properties of manifolds invariant under homeomorphism (e.g., Betti numbers, homology, intersection form).

concepts.label: finiteness property
concepts.description: A contact structure for which the set of topological types of exact or strong fillings is finite.

concepts.label: Betti numbers
concepts.description: Topological invariants counting independent cycles in homology; bounds constrain the complexity of fillings.

concepts.label: integral homology
concepts.description: Homology with integer coefficients; classifies manifolds up to certain homotopy invariants.

concepts.label: intersection form
concepts.description: A bilinear form on middle-dimensional homology measuring the algebraic intersection number of cycles.

concepts.label: adjunction inequality
concepts.description: A constraint relating the genus of a symplectic surface to the first Chern class, used in uniruled/adjunction obstruction theory.

concepts.label: Fermat hypersurface
concepts.description: A hypersurface defined by a weighted homogeneous Fermat equation in weighted projective space, providing explicit algebraic models for Calabi-Yau orbifolds.

concepts.label: Fermat motive
concepts.description: An algebraic cycle or cohomological object associated to Fermat hypersurfaces, capturing the arithmetic and homological structure.

concepts.label: Picard-Fuchs equation
concepts.description: A differential equation satisfied by the periods of a family of algebraic varieties, encoding monodromy and mirror symmetry structure.

concepts.label: period integral
concepts.description: An integral of the holomorphic volume form over a homological cycle, whose variation under moduli defines the Picard-Fuchs operator.

concepts.label: Dwork character
concepts.description: A character-valued p-adic analytic invariant used in Dwork's method to count rational points on algebraic varieties via Gauss sums.

concepts.label: Gauss sum
concepts.description: A character sum ∑_{x∈𝔽_q} χ(x)ψ(f(x)) encoding arithmetic information; appears in both Jacobi sum and Dwork p-adic point-counting methods.

concepts.label: monomial class
concepts.description: A graded monomial in a polynomial ring subject to group actions, encoding the structure of toric hypersurfaces in weighted projective space.

concepts.label: weighted projective space
concepts.description: A generalization of projective space where homogeneous coordinates are weighted; used to realize singular CY hypersurfaces with toric structure.

concepts.label: p-adic method
concepts.description: An analytic technique using p-adic numbers and character theory to count rational points, complementary to algebraic number-theoretic approaches.

concepts.label: rational point enumeration
concepts.description: The computation of the number of 𝔽_q-rational points on an algebraic variety, a key invariant linking geometry and arithmetic.

concepts.label: middle cohomology
concepts.description: The cohomology group H³ of a 3-dimensional variety, which carries topological and arithmetic information via Hodge theory.

concepts.label: elliptic surface
concepts.description: A surface equipped with a fibration by elliptic curves; provides modular forms and L-functions via the Mordell-Weil group.

concepts.label: Galois representation
concepts.description: A homomorphism from the absolute Galois group of a field into the general linear group of a vector space.

concepts.label: Lefschetz fixed-point theorem
concepts.description: Topological theorem computing the trace of an endomorphism on cohomology via fixed points of the induced geometric action.

concepts.label: étale cohomology
concepts.description: Cohomology theory for varieties over fields using étale sheaves, generalizing singular cohomology to positive characteristic.

concepts.label: two-dimensional representation
concepts.description: A Galois representation acting on a 2-dimensional vector space, relevant for weight-2 modular forms.

concepts.label: Gopakumar-Vafa invariants
concepts.description: Integer-valued invariants of Calabi-Yau threefolds defined as specific linear combinations of Gromov-Witten invariants, counting BPS states.

concepts.label: Gromov-Witten invariants
concepts.description: Genus g, degree d enumerative invariants counting holomorphic curves in a Kähler manifold, weighted by the virtual class.

concepts.label: integrality
concepts.description: Property that a mathematically defined invariant takes integer values, proven here for GV invariants via elementary number theory.

concepts.label: genus vanishing
concepts.description: Phenomenon that Gopakumar-Vafa invariants for sufficiently high genus g vanish identically.

concepts.label: operator formalism
concepts.description: Technique using operator-algebraic methods to study invariant generating functions and their properties.

concepts.label: exponential formula
concepts.description: Combinatorial identity relating sums over graphs to exponentials of connected contributions, used in enumerative geometry.

concepts.label: virtual class
concepts.description: Fundamental class of the virtual fundamental cycle used to define invariants in intersection theory on moduli spaces.

concepts.label: enumerative geometry
concepts.description: Classical and modern theory counting geometric objects (curves, lines, cycles) satisfying given incidence conditions.

concepts.label: Froggatt-Nielsen mechanism
concepts.description: Explanation of fermion mass hierarchy via hierarchical Yukawa textures, typically realized through additional U(1) symmetry and scalar vevs.

concepts.label: Anomaly mediated SUSY breaking
concepts.description: Mechanism where supersymmetry breaking is communicated to the observable sector through gravitational anomaly multiplet, generating soft masses.

concepts.label: Anomaly-free U(1) symmetry
concepts.description: Abelian gauge symmetry with vanishing triangle anomalies (∑Q³ = 0, ∑Q = 0), constraining charge assignments and Yukawa structures.

concepts.label: Yukawa texture
concepts.description: Pattern of zero and non-zero entries in the Yukawa coupling matrix, determined by selection rules from discrete and gauge symmetries.

concepts.label: Flavor-changing neutral current
concepts.description: Tree or loop-level process violating flavor conservation (e.g., K→μμ); constrained by Yukawa texture structure and symmetry.

concepts.label: Slepton mass problem
concepts.description: In AMSB, slepton soft masses are negative or unstable due to anomaly mediation; requires additional mechanism or symmetry to resolve.

concepts.label: klt Calabi-Yau pair
concepts.description: A projective log pair with Kawamata log terminal singularities and trivial canonical divisor, central to the study of singular CY geometry.

concepts.label: fundamental group
concepts.description: The topological invariant π₁(X) encoding loops and homotopy classes on a variety; characterizes global geometric structure.

concepts.label: almost abelianity
concepts.description: Property that the fundamental group admits a finite-index normal abelian subgroup, weakening full abelianity.

concepts.label: normal abelian subgroup
concepts.description: A commutative subgroup closed under conjugation by elements of the ambient group, enabling solvability structure.

concepts.label: solvable subgroup
concepts.description: A group with a composition series whose factors are abelian; extends abelian structure through derived series.

concepts.label: regular locus
concepts.description: The open subset of a variety where the singularities are removed; the smooth points form the classical geometric locus.

concepts.label: Kawamata log terminal singularities
concepts.description: Mild singularities characterized by a log resolution discrepancy condition; standard singularity class in birational geometry.

concepts.label: finite index
concepts.description: Property that a subgroup H of G has [G:H] < ∞, measuring how much of the group structure is captured by H.

concepts.label: dimension three geometry
concepts.description: Study of 3-dimensional algebraic varieties, where coregularity bounds and fundamental group structure become tractable.

concepts.label: canonical divisor
concepts.description: The line bundle K_X encoding differential forms on X; vanishes on CY varieties and measures singularity type on log pairs.

concepts.label: log resolution
concepts.description: A birational morphism from a smooth variety that resolves the singularities of a log pair, enabling discrepancy analysis.

concepts.label: gonality
concepts.description: The minimal degree of a morphism from a curve to the projective line; a classical measure of the complexity of a curve's geometry.

concepts.label: Clifford index
concepts.description: An invariant of a curve measuring the gap between the genus and the minimal degree of special line bundles; captures subtle arithmetic-geometric properties.

concepts.label: complete linear system
concepts.description: The projective space of global sections of a line bundle, parameterizing all divisors in the complete linear equivalence class.

concepts.label: Clifford dimension
concepts.description: A refinement of the Clifford index; the minimal number of generators of special line bundles with maximal Clifford index.

concepts.label: very ample line bundle
concepts.description: A line bundle whose global sections embed the variety birationally into projective space; a key condition for projective geometry.

concepts.label: embedding properties
concepts.description: Conditions determining whether a line bundle or divisor yields a closed immersion or birational embedding into projective space.

concepts.label: nef line bundle
concepts.description: A line bundle with non-negative degree on every curve; a weakening of ampleness used in modern classification.

concepts.label: birationally very ample
concepts.description: A line bundle that defines a birational morphism to projective space; weaker than very ample but sufficient for many applications.

concepts.label: genus
concepts.description: The topological invariant g of a smooth curve, relating to its Picard group rank and moduli dimension.

concepts.label: special line bundle
concepts.description: A line bundle on a curve with global sections or non-trivial cohomology in the dual; central to classical curve theory.

concepts.label: local delta invariant
concepts.description: A local stability threshold measuring the singularity-free parameter space for a smooth variety at a point; classifies when the invariant is rational or irrational.

concepts.label: quasi-F-splitting
concepts.description: A mixed characteristic analogue of F-singularities that generalizes F-splitting to positive characteristic techniques applicable in mixed characteristic settings.

concepts.label: mixed characteristic
concepts.description: A commutative algebra setting where a ring contains both zero and nonzero characteristic elements, typically rings of integers in number fields or p-adic rings.

concepts.label: Kodaira vanishing
concepts.description: A vanishing theorem for cohomology of line bundles on smooth varieties, fundamental in algebraic geometry for bounding dimensions of global sections.

concepts.label: rational double point
concepts.description: A surface singularity of finite type over a field with resolution of singularities yielding a tree of rational curves; classified by Dynkin diagrams.

concepts.label: F-singularities
concepts.description: Singularities defined via Frobenius action in positive characteristic; include F-regular, F-pure, and F-rational singularities.

concepts.label: smooth lifting
concepts.description: The process of lifting a singular or special variety from characteristic p or a quotient to a smooth variety over a larger or characteristic-zero ring.

concepts.label: vanishing theorem
concepts.description: A general result asserting that certain sheaf cohomology groups vanish under geometric or divisibility conditions, central to positivity in algebraic geometry.

concepts.label: Frobenius morphism
concepts.description: The endomorphism x ↦ x^p on a scheme in characteristic p; induces pullback on sheaves and cohomology, fundamental in commutative algebra.

concepts.label: cohomology of line bundles
concepts.description: Sheaf cohomology groups H^i(X, L) for a line bundle L on a scheme X; measures obstructions to sections and global geometry.

concepts.label: K3 surface
concepts.description: A smooth projective surface with trivial canonical bundle and H¹(X, O_X) = 0; universal cover in the Enriques-Kodaira classification.

concepts.label: monodromy group
concepts.description: The group of automorphisms of a fiber induced by analytic continuation around singular loci in the base; measures topological obstruction to extending local trivialisations.

concepts.label: Weyl group
concepts.description: The finite group of symmetries generated by reflections in the root system of a Coxeter-Cartan algebra; for E₆, has order 51,840.

concepts.label: exceptional curves
concepts.description: Rational curves on a del Pezzo surface with self-intersection −1; degree d del Pezzo contains 9−d such curves forming an E₆ root system for d=3.

concepts.label: arithmetic lattice
concepts.description: A discrete subgroup of a Lie group arising from integer points in an algebraic group; characterized by discriminant and signature of quadratic form.

concepts.label: unitary group
concepts.description: The group U(L) of isometries of a Hermitian lattice L over an imaginary quadratic field; U₃,3(ℤ[i]) preserves signature (3,3) Hermitian form.

concepts.label: quadratic form
concepts.description: A homogeneous degree-2 polynomial; over number fields, classified by signature and discriminant; type U means Hermitian form with complex coefficients.

concepts.label: branching locus
concepts.description: The locus in the base space over which the branched cover is ramified; for cyclic covers of ℙ² over degree-d curves, a codimension-1 discriminant variety.

concepts.label: family of surfaces
