concepts.description: A parameterized collection of algebraic surfaces, typically a projective morphism S → B with smooth generic fiber; monodromy acts on cohomology of fibers.

concepts.label: period domain
concepts.description: A symmetric domain parameterizing Hodge structures of fixed type; period map sends points in family to period matrices; monodromy is image of π₁(base).

concepts.label: Landau-Ginzburg superpotential
concepts.description: A holomorphic function encoding the instanton-corrected geometry of a mirror variety; realizable as a limit of hyperKähler rotation.

concepts.label: hyperKähler rotation
concepts.description: Continuous deformation of a Kähler metric to a hyperKähler metric, allowing transition toward large complex structure limits and mirror geometry.

concepts.label: integral affine structure
concepts.description: A piecewise-linear structure on a manifold with transition maps in SL(n,ℤ); encodes the base geometry of special Lagrangian fibrations.

concepts.label: Floer-theoretical mirror
concepts.description: Mirror variety constructed via Floer cohomology and instanton counting on Lagrangian submanifolds, without assuming large-volume asymptotics.

concepts.label: A∞-singularity
concepts.description: Cyclic quotient surface singularity of type Z/nZ action on C²; admits smoothings whose Landau-Ginzburg mirrors can be computed via gluing.

concepts.label: monotone del Pezzo
concepts.description: Del Pezzo surface satisfying the monotonicity condition for Floer cohomology; admits well-defined Lagrangian intersection theory.

concepts.label: gluing method
concepts.description: Technique for constructing Landau-Ginzburg mirrors by gluing local Floer-theoretical mirrors of singularities; combines local and global geometry.

concepts.label: Springer fibre
concepts.description: The fibre of the Springer resolution map over a nilpotent element in a Lie algebra; encodes representation-theoretic data of the corresponding group.

concepts.label: exceptional group
concepts.description: A simple algebraic group of type E₆, E₇, E₈, F₄, or G₂, distinguished by non-classical root system geometry.

concepts.label: simply elliptic singularity
concepts.description: A surface singularity with fundamental cycle of arithmetic genus 1 and cyclic fundamental group, e.g., T_{p,q,r}.

concepts.label: principal bundle
concepts.description: A fibre bundle P → X with structure group G acting freely on the total space P, whose sections correspond to G-torsors.

concepts.label: elliptic curve
concepts.description: A smooth projective curve of genus 1 with a marked point, forming an abelian variety and central to algebraic geometry.

concepts.label: stack of principal bundles
concepts.description: A moduli stack parametrizing G-bundles over a fixed base; accommodates non-reduced and non-separated structures.

concepts.label: D₆ dihedral group
concepts.description: The dihedral group of order 12 with presentation ⟨r, s | r⁶ = s² = (rs)² = e⟩, the largest discrete symmetry in certain CY polytopes.

concepts.label: integral Lagrangian torus
concepts.description: A Lagrangian torus in a symplectic manifold whose relative area homomorphism is integer-valued.

concepts.label: Clifford torus
concepts.description: A specific Lagrangian torus defined as the product of two circles of equal radius in a complex surface, serving as a standard example in symplectic topology.

concepts.label: Lagrangian packing
concepts.description: A maximal disjoint collection of Lagrangian submanifolds such that any other Lagrangian of the same type must intersect at least one element of the collection.

concepts.label: symplectic geometry
concepts.description: Mathematical study of symplectic manifolds and Lagrangian submanifolds, providing the framework for studying Lagrangian tori and their packings.

concepts.label: relative area homomorphism
concepts.description: A homomorphism measuring the signed area of a Lagrangian submanifold relative to a chosen reference, used to classify integral versus non-integral Lagrangian tori.

concepts.label: Lagrangian intersection
concepts.description: The intersection of two Lagrangian submanifolds in a symplectic manifold, a fundamental invariant in symplectic topology.

concepts.label: K3 fibration
concepts.description: A fibration structure where the generic fibre is a K3 surface, providing a geometric tool for constructing CY3 compactifications with controlled moduli.

concepts.label: moduli stabilisation
concepts.description: Mechanism to fix all scalar moduli (Kähler and complex structure) to definite values using fluxes, non-perturbative effects, and alpha-prime corrections.

concepts.label: toric geometry
concepts.description: Algebraic-geometric framework exploiting torus actions to construct and analyse CY varieties via polytopes and fan combinatorics.

concepts.label: chiral matter
concepts.description: Fermion zero modes on D-branes wrapping cycles with non-zero index; realises matter content of the Standard Model in string compactifications.

concepts.label: divisor topology
concepts.description: Geometric invariants (Chern numbers, Hodge numbers, self-intersection) characterising divisor classes within the CY three-fold; determined by polytope structure.

concepts.label: geometric transition
concepts.description: A duality between type IIA and type IIB string theory induced by conifold or del Pezzo transitions, relating closed-string amplitudes to open-string instanton corrections.

concepts.label: Chern-Simons gauge theory
concepts.description: A 2+1 dimensional topological gauge theory defined by a Chern-Simons level k, where the action is purely topological and the theory exhibits non-trivial infrared dynamics.

concepts.label: topological amplitude
concepts.description: Genus g amplitude in topological string theory computing Gromov-Witten invariants; encodes open and closed string worldsheet instanton contributions.

concepts.label: local del Pezzo model
concepts.description: Non-compact Calabi-Yau geometry fibered by del Pezzo surfaces over a base, used to study open string instantons and their mirror duals in Chern-Simons theory.

concepts.label: du Val singularities
concepts.description: Quotient singularities of type A-D-E arising from finite subgroups of SU(2); classified by Dynkin diagrams and preserved under certain discrete symmetries.

concepts.label: ample divisor
concepts.description: A divisor D on a variety such that 𝒪(D) is ample; on del Pezzo surfaces, ample divisors generate the positive cone and enable cylinder construction via geometric methods.

concepts.label: type I' theory
concepts.description: Type I string theory with orientifold projection studied at 9 dimensions via probe D4-branes in CY compactifications.

concepts.label: Clebsch-Gordan coefficient
concepts.description: Numerical factor appearing in the decomposition of group representations; determines fixed ratios of non-zero Yukawa matrix elements under discrete symmetry.

concepts.label: anomalous U(1) symmetry
concepts.description: Gauge symmetry anomalous at the quantum level but preserved by Green-Schwarz counterterms; can suppress dangerous proton-decay operators.

concepts.label: del Pezzo threefold
concepts.description: A Fano threefold with anticanonical divisor -K_X ample, arising as blow-ups of P³ at points; nodal versions have rational double point singularities.

concepts.label: derived category
concepts.description: The homotopy category of bounded complexes of coherent sheaves D^b(coh X), encoding the linear algebraic geometry of a variety.

concepts.label: semiorthogonal decomposition
concepts.description: A filtration of a triangulated category into orthogonal subcategories, generalizing direct sum decomposition to the derived setting.

concepts.label: Kawamata decomposition
concepts.description: A semiorthogonal decomposition of the derived category of a Fano variety into the derived category of a curve and exceptional collections, named after Kawamata's construction method.

concepts.label: exceptional collection
concepts.description: A sequence of sheaves or complexes in a triangulated category such that Hom between distinct objects vanishes and each is rigid, providing a full strong generator.

concepts.label: singular del Pezzo
concepts.description: A del Pezzo surface or threefold with nodal or other mild singularities, obtained as blow-ups of P² or P³ where some centers coincide or lie on exceptional divisors.

concepts.label: relative tilting decomposition
concepts.description: A family of semiorthogonal decompositions that interpolates between singular and smooth fibers of a morphism, generalizing tilting theory to relative geometry.

concepts.label: coherent sheaf
concepts.description: A sheaf of modules over the structure sheaf of a variety, generalizing vector bundles and encoding the geometric and algebraic structure.

concepts.label: triangulated category
concepts.description: An additive category equipped with a suspension functor and distinguished triangles satisfying axioms analogous to homological algebra, organizing derived objects.

concepts.label: cylinder
concepts.description: An open algebraic subset isomorphic to A¹ × U for a quasi-affine variety U; indicators of rational geometry and flexibility.

concepts.label: K-polar cylinder
concepts.description: A cylinder whose closure is a divisor in the anticanonical linear system |−mK_X| for positive integer m.

concepts.label: tiger
concepts.description: A tropical or combinatorial geometric object whose support characterizes the existence of cylinders in del Pezzo surfaces.

concepts.label: support of tiger
concepts.description: The underlying locus or set-theoretic component of a tiger that determines intersection with divisors.

concepts.label: Dynkin diagram
concepts.description: Graph classification of root systems and singularities; ADE types correspond to du Val singularity types.

concepts.label: rational geometry
concepts.description: Study of varieties with rich families of rational curves and algebraic automorphisms, including flexibility and cylinder existence.

concepts.label: Becker-Becker-Strominger formula
concepts.description: Explicit formula computing world-sheet instanton corrections to four-fermion correlators in type-IIA Calabi-Yau compactifications.

concepts.label: Four-fermion correlator
concepts.description: Amplitude ⟨ψᵢψⱼψₖψₗ⟩ governing quark and lepton mass matrices and their mixing in the effective low-energy action.

concepts.label: Type-IIA superstring
concepts.description: Ten-dimensional chiral superstring theory with two supercharges of the same chirality; compactified on CY3 to yield N=2 supersymmetry in 4D.

concepts.label: Pati-Salam GUT
concepts.description: Grand unified theory with gauge group SU(4)_C × SU(2)_L × SU(2)_R unifying strong, weak, and electromagnetic interactions with left-right symmetry.

concepts.label: Selection rule
concepts.description: Constraint on allowed Yukawa and interaction vertices arising from symmetry principles; determines which matrix elements vanish or are related by group theory.

concepts.label: Reflection symmetry
concepts.description: Automorphism of the Calabi-Yau polytope induced by coordinate reflections in the mirror lattice; generates discrete symmetry group actions.

concepts.label: log del Pezzo surface
concepts.description: A normal projective log-terminal surface where a multiple of the anti-canonical divisor is ample, generalizing del Pezzo surfaces to singular settings.

concepts.label: index three
concepts.description: The minimal positive integer such that a multiple of the anti-canonical divisor becomes Cartier and ample; specifies the divisibility class of the surface.

concepts.label: Cartier divisor
concepts.description: A divisor that is locally principal; a technical condition ensuring divisibility properties needed for ampleness.

concepts.label: normal projective surface
concepts.description: A 2-dimensional algebraic variety that is normal (integrally closed in its function field) and projective (embeds in projective space).

concepts.label: surface classification
concepts.description: Systematic enumeration and characterization of algebraic surfaces according to invariants such as singularities and divisor properties.

concepts.label: Nakayama argument
concepts.description: A classification technique used to systematically enumerate surfaces by analyzing divisor constraints and singularity types.

concepts.label: del Pezzo variety
concepts.description: Higher-dimensional analogue of del Pezzo surfaces; Fano varieties with ample anticanonical divisor used in algebraic geometry and string compactifications.

concepts.label: Yang-Mills equation
concepts.description: Classical equation of motion for non-abelian gauge fields governing the dynamics of color-electric and color-magnetic fields.

concepts.label: color-electric field
concepts.description: Non-abelian gauge field component describing the electric-type interactions between colored charges in SU(2) gauge theory.

concepts.label: Meissner effect
concepts.description: Expulsion of magnetic field from a superconductor below its critical temperature; dual effect refers to expulsion of color-electric field.

concepts.label: instanton orientation
concepts.description: Angular degree of freedom or internal orientation of the instanton configuration affecting its interaction with external fields.

concepts.label: instanton core
concepts.description: Spatial region centered on the instanton where the non-perturbative topological configuration is localized and field effects are strongest.

concepts.label: SU(2) gauge group
concepts.description: Special unitary group of order 2 defining the non-abelian gauge symmetry of the Yang-Mills theory studied.

concepts.label: Lorentz gauge
concepts.description: Gauge-fixing condition ∂_μ A^μ = 0 constraining the gauge field degrees of freedom in classical gauge theory.

concepts.label: vacuum state
concepts.description: Ground state of the gauge theory; in this context contrasted between perturbative vacuum and non-perturbative instanton-containing state.

concepts.label: topological effect
concepts.description: Physical consequence arising from the topological properties of the gauge field configuration rather than perturbative interactions.

concepts.label: NMSSM
concepts.description: Next-to-Minimal Supersymmetric Standard Model extending the MSSM with an additional singlet Higgs field.

concepts.label: neutralino
concepts.description: Fermionic superpartner of electroweak gauge bosons and Higgs in supersymmetric models; lightest neutralino is a dark matter candidate.

concepts.label: CP-odd Higgs
concepts.description: Pseudoscalar Higgs boson with opposite CP parity to the CP-even Higgs; present in extended Higgs sectors like NMSSM.

concepts.label: spin-dependent scattering
concepts.description: Nuclear recoil process dependent on nucleon spin alignment; relevant for WIMP-nucleus interactions mediated by axial-vector couplings.

concepts.label: eta(b) resonance
concepts.description: Quarkonium bound state of b-quark pairs; an intermediate resonance that can mix with pseudoscalar Higgs bosons.

concepts.label: direct detection
concepts.description: Experimental search for WIMP-nucleus scattering events in underground detectors.

concepts.label: effective coupling
concepts.description: Renormalized or effective interaction strength between particles, accounting for quantum corrections and resonance effects.

concepts.label: B physics constraints
concepts.description: Experimental bounds from rare B-meson decays and flavor-changing neutral currents; stringent tests of physics beyond the SM.

concepts.label: lepton universality
concepts.description: Principle that all three lepton families couple identically to gauge bosons; violations hint at physics beyond the Standard Model.

concepts.label: Upsilon decay
concepts.description: Decay of bottomonium resonance (bb̄ bound state); precision processes sensitive to new pseudoscalar contributions.

concepts.label: dark matter candidate
concepts.description: Hypothetical particle or system explaining observed dark matter through gravitational interactions; neutralino is a leading example.

concepts.label: resonance mixing
concepts.description: Quantum mechanical mixing between two resonant states via off-diagonal matrix elements; enhances effective couplings near mass shell.

concepts.label: velocity suppression
concepts.description: Kinematic suppression of cross sections at low relative velocities typical in galactic dark matter halo; depends on v² or q² in scattering.

concepts.label: Gorenstein toric Fano variety
concepts.description: A toric variety with Gorenstein singularities and ample anticanonical class, forming the base class for toric Del Pezzo varieties.

concepts.label: reflexive polygon
concepts.description: A lattice polygon whose polar dual is also a lattice polygon; used to classify two-dimensional toric varieties.

concepts.label: Minkowski sum decomposition
concepts.description: Expression of a lattice polytope as a sum of smaller polytopes; classifies combinatorial structures of toric varieties.

concepts.label: toric variety
concepts.description: An algebraic variety containing an algebraic torus as a dense open subset and admitting a torus action.

concepts.label: almost Del Pezzo manifold
concepts.description: A variety with properties near Del Pezzo classification; studied via deformation theory in dimension 2.

concepts.label: Gorenstein singularity
concepts.description: A Cohen-Macaulay singularity with dualizing sheaf isomorphic to a line bundle; generalizes smoothness.

concepts.label: biregular classification
concepts.description: Classification of varieties up to birational equivalence preserving the biregular structure.

concepts.label: cone over variety
concepts.description: The affine cone over a projective variety, obtained by contracting the projectivization.

concepts.label: fractional index
concepts.description: The maximal positive rational number r such that the anticanonical divisor can be expressed as r times a Cartier divisor; measures singularity severity.

concepts.label: Nakayama classification technique
concepts.description: Systematic method for classifying surfaces with bounded singularities and divisor arithmetic constraints via divisibility and index theory.

concepts.label: singularities
concepts.description: Points where a variety fails to be smooth; classified by their geometric and arithmetic properties (e.g., log terminal, canonical).

concepts.label: G-action
concepts.description: A morphism from a group G into the automorphism group of a variety, defining an equivariant geometric structure.

concepts.label: linear equivalence
concepts.description: Divisors D₁ and D₂ are linearly equivalent if D₁ − D₂ is principal; equivalence relation generating the Picard group.

concepts.label: log canonical threshold
concepts.description: The largest coefficient c such that the pair (X, cD) is log canonical; measures singularity severity of divisor D on surface X.

concepts.label: effective divisor classification
concepts.description: Systematic enumeration of all divisors in a fixed linear system or birational class on an algebraic variety.

concepts.label: D-branes
concepts.description: Extended objects in string theory carrying Ramond-Ramond charge, described by endpoints of open strings in type II theories.

concepts.label: del Pezzo surfaces
concepts.description: Smooth Fano surfaces with ample anticanonical class, classified by degree 1–9; provide non-perturbative contributions to string compactifications.

concepts.label: Calabi-Yau manifolds
concepts.description: Complex Kähler manifolds with vanishing first Chern class used to compactify extra dimensions in string theory.

concepts.label: quiver gauge theories
concepts.description: Gauge theories whose field content and interactions are encoded by a directed graph (quiver diagram), often arising from D-brane configurations.

concepts.label: D0-branes
concepts.description: Point-like D-branes of dimension 0 with maximal energy density; probing toric singularities in string compactifications.

concepts.label: D4-branes
concepts.description: 4-dimensional spatial worldvolume D-branes carrying RR 5-form charge; wrap on 4-cycles in Calabi-Yau compactifications.

concepts.label: fuzzy del Pezzo
concepts.description: Non-commutative (fuzzy) deformation of classical del Pezzo surface geometry arising in quiver gauge theory vacua.

concepts.label: fuzzy CP²
concepts.description: Non-commutative deformation of complex projective plane via matrix algebra, with moduli parametrizing deformation geometry.

concepts.label: fluctuation spectrum
concepts.description: Spectrum of small oscillations around a solution; characterises stability and quantum corrections to classical field configurations.

concepts.label: F(uzz) theory
concepts.description: Proposed fuzzy (non-commutative) deformation of F-theory on del Pezzo surfaces at orbifold singularities.

concepts.label: weak del Pezzo surface
concepts.description: A normal projective surface with negative anti-canonical divisor and mild singularities, generalizing del Pezzo surfaces.

concepts.label: del Pezzo fibration
concepts.description: A fibration structure where the generic fibers are del Pezzo surfaces, a classical object in algebraic geometry.

concepts.label: weak del Pezzo fibration
concepts.description: A fibration where the fibers are weak del Pezzo surfaces, generalizing the classical del Pezzo fibration.

concepts.label: generic fiber
concepts.description: The fiber of a fibration over a generic point of the base, representing the generic geometric structure.

concepts.label: minimal weak del Pezzo surface
concepts.description: A weak del Pezzo surface with no exceptional divisors, representing the simplest form of such surfaces.

concepts.label: characteristic zero field
concepts.description: A field whose prime field is the rationals ℚ, excluding positive characteristic arithmetic geometry.

concepts.label: double cover
concepts.description: A finite morphism of degree 2 between varieties; on degree one del Pezzo surfaces, the linear series |2(-K_X)| exhibits the surface as a double cover of a quadric cone.

concepts.label: quadric cone
concepts.description: A degenerate quadric surface with a singular point; serves as the base surface for the double cover structure of degree one del Pezzo surfaces.

concepts.label: compactification
concepts.description: A process of adding boundary points to extend a variety to a compact space; the paper constructs explicit boundary compactifications of del Pezzo moduli spaces.

concepts.label: broken del Pezzo surface
concepts.description: A singular or reducible surface on the boundary of the moduli space, arising as degenerations of smooth del Pezzo surfaces while retaining anti-canonical polarization.

concepts.label: anti-canonically polarized
concepts.description: A polarization structure on a variety defined by the anti-canonical divisor class; used to organize the moduli stack of del Pezzo surfaces.

concepts.label: degeneration
concepts.description: A family of varieties specializing to a singular or reducible limit; the paper studies degenerations of the quadric cone as part of the boundary classification.

concepts.label: non-commutative geometry
concepts.description: Geometric framework replacing commutative coordinate algebras with non-commutative algebras, parameterised by θ-deformation terms in string theory.

concepts.label: D-brane
concepts.description: Topological defect (Dirichlet boundary condition) in string theory wrapping cycles in the Calabi-Yau, sourcing Standard Model gauge groups and matter.

concepts.label: fractional D-brane
concepts.description: D-brane bound to an orbifold singularity, carrying charge under the discrete orbifold action and sourcing matter in orbifold compactifications.

concepts.label: Calabi-Yau hypersurface
concepts.description: Smooth codimension-1 subvariety of a toric variety defined by a homogeneous polynomial, realising Calabi-Yau geometry in explicit coordinates.

concepts.label: Clifford algebra
concepts.description: Associative algebra generated by generators satisfying {eᵢ, eⱼ} = 2δᵢⱼ, providing representation framework for higher-dimensional spinors and symmetries.

concepts.label: orbifold singularity
concepts.description: Isolated singular point arising from the group quotient, locally modelled by C^n/Γ, site of fractional brane attachment.

concepts.label: quotient stack
concepts.description: Algebraic stack [X/G] representing the quotient of a variety by a group action, providing a geometric framework for orbifold constructions.

concepts.label: string orbifold
concepts.description: String theory compactification on a singular space obtained as a quotient X/Γ of a smooth variety by a discrete group Γ, with twisted sectors arising from fixed-point sets.

concepts.label: B field
concepts.description: NSNS 2-form field in string theory that geometrically encodes discrete torsion data via its quantized periods on orbifold cycles.

concepts.label: twisted sector
concepts.description: String states localized at the fixed-point set of a non-identity group action g ∈ Γ in an orbifold, coupling to discrete torsion via H²(Γ, U(1)).

concepts.label: Ramond-Ramond charges
concepts.description: Conserved charges carried by D-branes in Type II string theory, measured by algebraic K-theory and restricted by topological constraints.

concepts.label: topological obstruction
concepts.description: A cohomological constraint restricting allowed configurations in a physical system; here applied to D-brane charges when B-field is topologically non-trivial.

concepts.label: Chan-Paton factors
concepts.description: Degrees of freedom associated with open string endpoints on D-branes, forming matrix representations of gauge groups on the brane worldvolume.

concepts.label: projective representations
concepts.description: Matrix representations of a group defined up to phase factors, arising naturally when orbifold actions are lifted to open string sectors with discrete torsion.

concepts.label: fractional branes
concepts.description: D-branes localized at orbifold singularities whose Ramond-Ramond charges are fractional multiples of the unit charge, arising from the orbifold quotient structure.

concepts.label: algebraic K-theory
concepts.description: Mathematical framework classifying vector bundles and measuring topological charges; used here to define RR charge groups in orbifold geometries via twisted cross products.

concepts.label: twisted cross product
concepts.description: An algebraic construction combining a group Γ with a module, used to define K-theory groups for D-branes in orbifolds with discrete torsion.

concepts.label: worldsheet consistency
concepts.description: Quantum mechanical consistency conditions on the 2D conformal field theory describing strings; constrains brane configurations and discrete torsion choices.

concepts.label: Type II string theory
concepts.description: Superstring theory with two supersymmetries, including Type IIA and IIB; the natural setting for D-branes carrying Ramond-Ramond charges.

concepts.label: open string
concepts.description: A string with two endpoints, typically ending on D-branes; carries Chan-Paton indices and couples to gauge fields on the brane worldvolume.

concepts.label: closed string
concepts.description: A topologically closed string loop propagating in the full spacetime, mediating long-range forces and carrying geometric moduli charges.

concepts.label: superpotential
concepts.description: Holomorphic function of complex fields governing supersymmetric dynamics; induced by H-flux coupling to the geometry.

concepts.label: N=2 supersymmetry
concepts.description: Extended supersymmetry with two supercharges in four dimensions; preserved at special aligned H-flux choices.

concepts.label: scalar potential
concepts.description: Effective potential energy functional for scalar fields in four-dimensional effective action; determined by H-flux and geometry.

concepts.label: degeneration point
concepts.description: Special locus in Calabi-Yau moduli space where the geometry becomes singular; admits supersymmetric ground states under aligned H-flux.

concepts.label: large volume limit
concepts.description: Asymptotic region of Kähler moduli space where the Calabi-Yau volume becomes large; studied for H-flux supersymmetry breaking.

concepts.label: Seiberg-Witten point
concepts.description: Special locus in type II moduli space where BPS states become massless; enhanced symmetry point for flux-induced superpotential analysis.

concepts.label: gauged N=2 supergravity
concepts.description: Supergravity formalism with minimal coupling to gauge fields; provides framework for understanding H-flux effects on effective action.

concepts.label: attractor mechanism
concepts.description: N=2 black hole property where moduli fields flow to fixed values independent of boundary conditions; analogous to H-flux vacuum structure.

concepts.label: partial supersymmetry breaking
concepts.description: Reduction of supersymmetry from N=2 to N=1 or N=0 through flux alignment or deformation; occurs at selected degeneration points.

concepts.label: McKay correspondence
concepts.description: Bijection between crepant resolutions of orbifold singularities and irreducible representations of the quotient group; encodes topology via group theory.

concepts.label: crepant resolution
concepts.description: A birational contraction that is small (preserves canonical divisor); yields a smooth Calabi-Yau from a singular orbifold.

concepts.label: complex structure deformation
concepts.description: Continuous change of the complex structure moduli of a variety; can deform orbifold to non-orbifold Calabi-Yau.

concepts.label: orbifold CFT
concepts.description: Conformal field theory associated to a string compactification on a Calabi-Yau orbifold; generalizes standard CFT to singular spaces.

concepts.label: topology of desingularization
concepts.description: Cohomological and Hodge-theoretic invariants of crepant resolutions; encodes how singularities resolve into smooth cycles.

concepts.label: damped harmonic oscillator
concepts.description: A second-order differential equation system describing oscillatory motion with energy dissipation, convertible to coupled first-order equations via two-by-two matrices.

concepts.label: little groups
concepts.description: Subgroups of the Lorentz group whose transformations leave the four-momentum of a particle invariant, dictating internal space-time symmetries.

concepts.label: four-momentum
concepts.description: A four-vector (E/c, p⃗) combining energy and spatial momentum; invariant under Lorentz transformations up to the Minkowski metric.

concepts.label: SO(3) symmetry
concepts.description: Special orthogonal group of 3×3 rotation matrices; describes spatial rotations leaving four-momentum invariant.

concepts.label: SO(3,1) symmetry
concepts.description: The proper orthochronous Lorentz group; symmetry group of Minkowski space and relativistic physics.

concepts.label: oscillation mode
concepts.description: The underdamped regime of a damped harmonic oscillator where the system exhibits periodic motion with exponential decay.

concepts.label: damping mode
concepts.description: The overdamped regime of a harmonic oscillator where solutions decay exponentially without oscillation, corresponding to massive or imaginary-mass particle little groups.

concepts.label: massless particle limit
concepts.description: The continuous reduction of particle mass to zero, achieved via non-Lorentzian parameterisation in the Poincaré sphere, transitioning between little group structures.

concepts.label: spin-1/2 particle
concepts.description: A fermionic particle with intrinsic angular momentum quantum number s=1/2, whose internal symmetries are governed by SU(2) little groups.

concepts.label: spin-1 particle
concepts.description: A bosonic particle with intrinsic angular momentum quantum number s=1, whose polarisation and internal symmetries are governed by SO(3) or U(1) little groups.

concepts.label: topological symmetry group
concepts.description: The group of automorphisms of a graph embedding in 3D space that can be realized by homeomorphisms of the ambient space and the embedded graph.

concepts.label: graph embedding
concepts.description: A realization of an abstract graph as a subset of Euclidean space, typically in ℝ³, preserving edge-connectivity and vertex adjacency.

concepts.label: Petersen family
concepts.description: A family of graphs in low-dimensional topology containing the Petersen graph and related graph structures.

concepts.label: abstract graph
concepts.description: A graph defined by its combinatorial structure (vertices and edges) without reference to a particular spatial realization.

concepts.label: homeomorphism
concepts.description: A continuous bijection with a continuous inverse that preserves topological structure.

concepts.label: graph automorphism
concepts.description: A permutation of vertices that preserves the edge structure of a graph.

concepts.label: low-dimensional topology
concepts.description: The study of topological spaces and manifolds of dimension ≤4, including knot theory and 3-manifolds.

concepts.label: molecular symmetry
concepts.description: The spatial symmetry properties of molecules in three-dimensional Euclidean space.

concepts.label: multiple-spin curves
concepts.description: Curves equipped with an m-tuple of spin structures, generalizing the notion of a single spin structure on a curve.

concepts.label: Deligne-Mumford compactification
concepts.description: A smooth compactification of a moduli space constructed using the framework of algebraic stacks and Deligne-Mumford theory.

concepts.label: quasi-stable curves
concepts.description: Curves with mild singularities (nodes) whose stable reduction properties allow extension of moduli to a boundary.

concepts.label: line bundles
concepts.description: Rank-1 vector bundles over a curve; here used as limiting objects to represent spin structures on singular curves.

concepts.label: spin structure
concepts.description: A choice of square root of the canonical bundle; equivalently, a lifting of a curve to a double cover branched at even divisors.

concepts.label: stacky curves
concepts.description: Curves viewed in the category of algebraic stacks, permitting non-reduced or orbifold singularities.

concepts.label: coarse moduli space
concepts.description: A scheme whose closed points classify objects of interest; the ordinary geometric quotient of a stack.

concepts.label: irreducible components
concepts.description: Connected maximal subsets of an algebraic variety; classification identifies which components arise in the moduli.

concepts.label: smooth compactification
concepts.description: An extension of a quasi-projective variety to a smooth projective variety with controlled boundary structure.

concepts.label: combinatorial description
concepts.description: An explicit combinatorial or graph-theoretic characterization of the local structure or stratification of a moduli space.

concepts.label: adjoint-symmetry
concepts.description: A 1-form on the solution space of a PDE that represents a dual counterpart to ordinary symmetries, characterized by invariance under system flows.

concepts.label: partial differential equation
concepts.description: An equation involving unknown functions and their partial derivatives; fundamental framework for modeling continuous physical systems.

concepts.label: solution space
concepts.description: The manifold of all solutions to a given PDE system, equipped with a geometric structure enabling tangent and cotangent analysis.

concepts.label: 1-form
concepts.description: A differential form of degree 1 assigning a linear functional to each tangent vector; dual object to vector fields.

concepts.label: evolution equation
concepts.description: A PDE system with a distinguished time evolution parameter; includes parabolic and hyperbolic PDEs describing temporal dynamics.

concepts.label: flow invariance
concepts.description: Property of a geometric object (1-form or vector field) remaining unchanged under the flow generated by a differential equation.

concepts.label: spatial constraint
concepts.description: An algebraic or differential constraint imposed on spatial coordinates in evolution equation systems, reducing the degrees of freedom.

concepts.label: normal 1-form
concepts.description: A 1-form orthogonal to the constraint surface defined by spatial constraints in a constrained PDE system.

concepts.label: functional multiplier
concepts.description: A scalar function of the solution and its derivatives that modulates the invariance of an adjoint-symmetry 1-form under constrained flows.

concepts.label: tangent vector field
concepts.description: A vector field on the solution manifold generating infinitesimal transformations; geometric representation of Lie symmetries.

concepts.label: geometrical formulation
concepts.description: A framework expressing properties of PDEs and their symmetries using differential geometry on the solution manifold.

concepts.label: Gross-Pitaevskii equation
concepts.description: Non-relativistic mean-field equation governing weakly-interacting Bose gases, describing the order parameter dynamics at finite temperature.

concepts.label: nonlinear Klein-Gordon equation
concepts.description: Relativistic scalar field equation with cubic interaction term, exhibiting spontaneous symmetry breaking in the relativistic regime.

concepts.label: Higgs mode
concepts.description: Gapped amplitude excitation in systems with spontaneous symmetry breaking; represents radial fluctuations in the order parameter manifold.

concepts.label: Bogoliubov spectrum
concepts.description: Dispersion relation of elementary excitations in weakly-interacting Bose gases, featuring a gapless phonon-like branch at low momenta.

concepts.label: phase-amplitude coupling
concepts.description: Interaction between Goldstone (phase) and Higgs (amplitude) modes leading to renormalization of excitation spectra.

concepts.label: Bose-Hubbard model
concepts.description: Lattice model of interacting bosons with kinetic and on-site interaction terms; exhibits superfluid-Mott insulator transition.

concepts.label: superfluid-Mott transition
concepts.description: Quantum phase transition between a delocalized superfluid phase and a localized Mott-insulating phase tuned by interaction strength.

concepts.label: elementary excitations
concepts.description: Collective or single-particle excitations above the ground state; characterize the spectrum and dynamical properties of a many-body system.

concepts.label: weakly-interacting Bose gas
concepts.description: Quantum gas where inter-particle interactions are small compared to kinetic energy; amenable to mean-field treatment.

concepts.label: flux vacua
concepts.description: Vacuum solutions in string theory obtained by fluxing RR and NSNS fields through Calabi-Yau cycles, stabilizing moduli.

concepts.label: attractor point
concepts.description: Special point in moduli space where near-extremal black hole entropy depends only on charges and not on asymptotic moduli values.

concepts.label: gauge mediation
concepts.description: Supersymmetry breaking mechanism where SUSY-breaking is communicated to the Standard Model via gauge interactions of messenger fields.

concepts.label: gaugino mass
concepts.description: Mass term for gauge superpartners (gluino, neutralino, chargino) arising from SUSY-breaking effects in the visible sector.

concepts.label: R-symmetry
concepts.description: Continuous or discrete global symmetry under which supercharges have R-charge ±1, constraining SUSY-breaking superpotential terms.

concepts.label: spurion field
concepts.description: Auxiliary chiral superfield carrying quantum numbers under global symmetries, whose vacuum expectation value breaks those symmetries.

concepts.label: R-charge
concepts.description: Quantum number assigned under R-symmetry, with supercharges carrying charge ±1 and scalar fields carrying integer charges.

concepts.label: messenger field
concepts.description: Heavy vector-like fermion-scalar pair coupling both to SUSY-breaking spurions and Standard Model gauge interactions.

concepts.label: one-loop gaugino mass
concepts.description: Gaugino mass generated at the one-loop level through virtual exchange of messenger fields, suppressed relative to tree-level contributions.

concepts.label: misaligned SUSY breaking
concepts.description: Configuration where multiple spurion fields break SUSY and R-symmetry independently with non-aligned vacuum expectation values.

concepts.label: R-charge arrangement
concepts.description: Specific assignment of R-charges to spurion and messenger fields determining whether one-loop gaugino masses are generated.

concepts.label: messenger mass scale
concepts.description: Characteristic mass M of messenger fermion-scalar pairs; gaugino masses are suppressed by powers of this scale.

concepts.label: hydrogen atom
concepts.description: The simplest two-body quantum system consisting of a proton and electron, fundamental to understanding atomic structure and quantum mechanics.

concepts.label: SO(4) degeneracy group
concepts.description: The symmetry group of the bound states of the hydrogen atom that explains the accidental degeneracy of energy levels with the same principal quantum number n.

concepts.label: SO(4,1) group
concepts.description: The non-invariance or spectrum-generating group that extends SO(4) to describe both bound and continuum states of hydrogen with unified quantum numbers.

concepts.label: SO(4,2) group
concepts.description: The expanded conformal symmetry group of hydrogen that encompasses all bound and continuum states and provides methods for computing radiative corrections.

concepts.label: Lamb shift
concepts.description: The small energy difference between the 2S₁/₂ and 2P₁/₂ states in hydrogen arising from quantum electrodynamic radiative corrections.

concepts.label: degeneracy
concepts.description: The phenomenon where multiple distinct quantum states possess the same energy level, explained by underlying symmetries of the Hamiltonian.

concepts.label: quantum mechanics
concepts.description: The fundamental theory governing the behavior of atomic and subatomic systems, for which hydrogen provides the archetypal exactly solvable model.

concepts.label: quantum electrodynamics
concepts.description: The quantum field theory describing the interaction of charged particles with the electromagnetic field, required to compute radiative corrections like the Lamb shift.

concepts.label: bound states
concepts.description: Energy eigenstates of negative energy in which the electron remains localized near the proton, characterized by principal quantum number n and angular momentum quantum numbers.

concepts.label: continuum states
concepts.description: Energy eigenstates with positive energy representing scattering states where the electron is unbound from the proton.

concepts.label: generating function
concepts.description: A mathematical tool that encodes information about radiative shifts for all energy levels in a single functional form.

concepts.label: elementary particle physics
concepts.description: The branch of physics studying the fundamental constituents of matter and their interactions, informed by principles discovered through hydrogen atom studies.

concepts.label: framed logarithmic connection
concepts.description: A logarithmic connection on a vector bundle over a Riemann surface with specified pole structure and framing data at marked points.

concepts.label: framed parabolic connection
concepts.description: A parabolic connection on a Riemann surface with prescribed weights at marked points and additional framing structure.

concepts.label: algebraic symplectic structure
concepts.description: A non-degenerate closed 2-form on an algebraic variety inducing a canonical symplectic geometry.

concepts.label: Riemann surface
concepts.description: One-dimensional complex manifold; the natural geometric setting for holomorphic connections and bundles.

concepts.label: regular functions
concepts.description: Holomorphic functions on an algebraic variety; elements of the coordinate ring.

concepts.label: transcendence degree
concepts.description: Dimension of a transcendence basis for a field extension; measures algebraic independence of generators.

concepts.label: vector bundle
concepts.description: A fibration where each fiber is a vector space and structure is locally trivial; used to encode connections.

concepts.label: pole structure
concepts.description: Specification of singularities and their orders at marked points on a curve.

concepts.label: marked points
concepts.description: Distinguished points on a Riemann surface where additional data (weights, framings) are prescribed.

concepts.label: F-theory compactification
concepts.description: Type IIB string theory with varying axio-dilaton on an elliptic or genus-one fibered Calabi-Yau 4-fold, producing a 6D effective action.

concepts.label: genus-one fibration
concepts.description: A Calabi-Yau 4-fold where each fiber over a 3-dimensional base is a genus-one curve; generalizes elliptic fibrations without assuming a section.

concepts.label: multisection
concepts.description: A divisor on a genus-one fibration that intersects each fiber in a finite set of points (generalizing a section, which intersects each fiber once).

concepts.label: intersection number
concepts.description: The topological invariant counting algebraic intersections between divisors or cycles on a manifold; determines degrees of multisections.

concepts.label: Segre embedding
concepts.description: A canonical projective embedding of a product of projective spaces ℙ^a × ℙ^b into ℙ^{(a+1)(b+1)-1}; used to construct CY via intersection.

concepts.label: hyperplane class
concepts.description: The cohomology class of a hyperplane divisor H in projective space; pullbacks under projections give divisor classes on CY 4-folds.

concepts.label: fiber class
concepts.description: The cohomology class of a fiber in a fibration; intersection with multisections determines their degree and associated discrete symmetries.

concepts.label: section
concepts.description: A divisor on a fibered variety that intersects each fiber transversely in exactly one point; guarantees a rational map to the base.

concepts.label: GL=12 polytope
concepts.description: Reflexive polytope with Gorenstein index 12, point group D₆, and Hodge numbers h¹¹=17, h²¹=20, defining a Calabi-Yau compactification.

concepts.label: Standard Model
concepts.description: Gauge theory with SU(3)_c × SU(2)_L × U(1)_Y symmetry describing strong and electroweak interactions and fermion content.

concepts.label: Vertical fluxes
concepts.description: Gauge fluxes in the elliptic fiber direction in F-theory models that contribute to breaking the geometric gauge group.

concepts.label: Remainder fluxes
concepts.description: Fluxes on the base of the elliptic fibration that can induce chiral matter and modulate gauge symmetry breaking independently of vertical components.

concepts.label: Exceptional gauge groups
concepts.description: Exceptional Lie groups (E₆, E₇, E₈, F₄, G₂) that arise generically in 4D F-theory compactifications and can be broken to the Standard Model.

concepts.label: Standard Model gauge group
concepts.description: The electroweak and strong force gauge symmetry SU(3)_C ⊗ SU(2)_L ⊗ U(1)_Y that governs all known fundamental interactions.

concepts.label: Intermediate GUT group
concepts.description: A Grand Unified Theory gauge group (e.g., SU(5), SO(10)) interpolating between exceptional groups and the Standard Model, used to mediate symmetry breaking.

concepts.label: Matter generation
concepts.description: Multiplicity of matter families (generations) in the particle spectrum; realistic models predict three generations.

concepts.label: U(1) gauge symmetry
concepts.description: Abelian gauge symmetry of rank one that can be Higgsed to generate discrete subgroups in F-theory.

concepts.label: SU(5) gauge group
concepts.description: Grand unified gauge symmetry whose embedding into the F-theory compactification geometry is compatible with discrete Higgsed symmetries.

concepts.label: matter curve
concepts.description: Locus in the base space of a fibration where matter fields with specified U(1) charges are localized in F-theory.

concepts.label: discrete charge
concepts.description: Quantum number assigned to matter fields under a discrete gauge symmetry; determines which Yukawa couplings and interactions are forbidden.

concepts.label: G-flux
concepts.description: Background flux of the four-form field strength in F-theory that contributes to the Calabi-Yau Euler characteristic and D3-brane tadpole.

concepts.label: Calabi-Yau Euler number
concepts.description: Topological invariant χ counting the alternating sum of Hodge numbers; constrained by flux and tadpole cancellation in F-theory.

concepts.label: D3-brane tadpole
concepts.description: Consistency condition in F-theory requiring the total D3-brane charge (from curvature, flux, and localized sources) to vanish.

concepts.label: Gauged linear sigma model
concepts.description: 2D N=2 gauge theory whose low-energy limit flows to a superconformal field theory; geometric interpretation as a toric variety.

concepts.label: Hirzebruch surface
concepts.description: Toric rational surface 𝔽ₙ = ℙ(𝒪 ⊕ 𝒪(n)) parametrized by a non-negative integer; basic example of toric varieties in string geometry.

concepts.label: Non-Abelian gauge group
concepts.description: Gauge symmetry group arising from singularities in the elliptic fibration of F-theory compactifications, classified by Kodaira singularity types.

concepts.label: Singularity type
concepts.description: Kodaira classification of degenerate fibers in an elliptic fibration, which determines the type and rank of the non-Abelian gauge group.

concepts.label: Rational elliptic 4-fold
concepts.description: A 4-dimensional rational surface with an elliptic fibration structure, used as building block in constructing special CY 4-folds.

concepts.label: U(1) gauge factor
concepts.description: Abelian gauge symmetry arising from rational sections of the elliptic fibration in F-theory, contributing to the low-energy gauge group.

concepts.label: Calabi-Yau fourfold
concepts.description: Complex 4-dimensional Kähler manifold with vanishing first Chern class, used for F-theory compactification to four dimensions.

concepts.label: F-theory duality
concepts.description: Equivalence between F-theory on CY4 and heterotic string on CY3, constraining cohomology and moduli.

concepts.label: functional renormalization group
concepts.description: Non-perturbative technique for computing renormalization group flow by integrating out quantum fluctuations systematically across all momentum scales.

concepts.label: quark-meson model
concepts.description: Effective field theory describing low-energy QCD dynamics through quark fields coupled to scalar and pseudoscalar meson degrees of freedom.

concepts.label: field-dependent Yukawa coupling
concepts.description: Yukawa coupling whose value depends on background scalar fields, generating non-trivial renormalization flow beyond conventional perturbative treatment.

concepts.label: renormalization group flow
concepts.description: Evolution of coupling constants and effective actions under changes in energy scale or momentum cutoff in quantum field theory.

concepts.label: chiral invariance
concepts.description: Symmetry of the Lagrangian under independent transformations of left- and right-handed fermion fields; fundamental to QCD at zero quark mass.

concepts.label: quantum fluctuations
concepts.description: Virtual particle-antiparticle pairs and vacuum excitations that modify effective couplings and generate new interaction terms at quantum level.

concepts.label: scalar field
concepts.description: Lorentz scalar quantum field that does not transform under Lorentz transformations; fundamental to meson phenomenology.

concepts.label: pseudoscalar field
concepts.description: Lorentz scalar field with pseudoscalar transformation properties under parity; represents pseudoscalar mesons in effective theories.

concepts.label: field rescaling
concepts.description: Redefinition of quantum field variables via multiplicative factors; affects wavefunction renormalization and coupling flow.

concepts.label: one-loop renormalization
concepts.description: Quantum corrections at the lowest non-trivial order in perturbation theory, captured by one-loop Feynman diagrams.

concepts.label: chirally invariant operators
concepts.description: Interaction terms in the effective action that preserve chiral symmetry; generated by quantum fluctuations and compete with Yukawa terms.

concepts.label: perturbative calculation
concepts.description: Quantum field theory computation based on expansion in coupling strength; assumes weak interactions and loop counting.

concepts.label: Yukawaon model
concepts.description: Theoretical framework where effective Yukawa coupling constants are represented as vacuum expectation values of gauge singlet scalar fields (yukawaons), enabling unified description of quark and lepton mass matrices.

concepts.label: Gauge singlet scalar
concepts.description: Scalar field that is invariant under gauge transformations and couples to fermions to generate effective Yukawa interactions through its vacuum expectation value.

concepts.label: Quark mass matrix
concepts.description: 3×3 matrix encoding the Yukawa couplings between quark generations and the Higgs boson, determining the physical quark mass eigenvalues and mixing angles.

concepts.label: Lepton mass matrix
concepts.description: 3×3 matrix of Yukawa couplings for leptons (charged leptons and neutrinos) encoding their interactions with the Higgs field and generating mass hierarchies.

concepts.label: Tribimaximal mixing
concepts.description: Specific pattern of lepton mixing angles in the PMNS matrix with θ₁₃=0, θ₁₂≈35.3°, θ₂₃=45°, approximately describing atmospheric neutrino oscillations.

concepts.label: Unified description
concepts.description: A single theoretical framework accounting for both quark and lepton mass matrices and mixing patterns without introducing separate independent parameters for each sector.

concepts.label: Vacuum expectation value
concepts.description: Non-zero ground state expectation value of a quantum field that breaks symmetry and generates physical masses through coupling to fermions.

concepts.label: Up-quark mass matrix
concepts.description: The 3×3 Yukawa coupling matrix for up-type quarks (u, c, t) whose structure is postulated in models to constrain lepton sector predictions.

concepts.label: PMNS matrix
concepts.description: Pontecorvo-Maki-Nakagawa-Sakata lepton mixing matrix analogous to the CKM matrix for quarks, parameterized by three mixing angles and a CP-violating phase.

concepts.label: left-right symmetry
concepts.description: Gauge theory framework based on SU(2)_L × SU(2)_R × U(1)_B-L that unifies weak interactions and predicts right-handed neutrinos.

concepts.label: Majorana neutrino mass
concepts.description: Lepton-number violating mass term for neutral leptons arising from dimension-five operators or seesaw mechanisms.

concepts.label: double seesaw mechanism
concepts.description: Two-stage suppression of neutrino mass: type-I seesaw (heavy right-handed neutrino) followed by type-II seesaw (triplet Higgs).

concepts.label: dimension-five operator
concepts.description: Non-renormalizable effective interaction suppressed by scale of new physics; generates fermion masses without tree-level Yukawa scalars.

concepts.label: D₆ representation
concepts.description: Irreducible module under the dihedral point group D₆ (order 12); Clebsch-Gordan decomposition determines Yukawa selection rules.

concepts.label: instanton correction
concepts.description: Non-perturbative exponential suppression exp(-2πτ) to couplings from wrapped Euclidean D3-branes; can fill zeros set by perturbative selection rules.

concepts.label: Kähler modulus
concepts.description: Modulus field parameterizing volume and geometry of 4-cycles in CY; τ_Swiss ≈ 8.3 for GL=12 polytope governs string scale and coupling.

concepts.label: binary icosahedral group
concepts.description: Double cover of the rotational icosahedral group (A₅), a finite discrete symmetry group of order 120 used as family symmetry for quark and lepton sectors.

concepts.label: icosahedral symmetry
concepts.description: Rotational symmetry group of the icosahedron (A₅) of order 60, previously proposed for lepton family symmetry.

concepts.label: tetrahedral symmetry
concepts.description: Rotational symmetry group of the tetrahedron (A₄) of order 12; its double cover has been successfully applied to quark-lepton unified models.

concepts.label: U(2) quark texture
concepts.description: Well-established phenomenological model of quark masses and mixings based on U(2) flavor symmetry, predicting specific mass ratios and CKM angles.

concepts.label: CKM mixing matrix
concepts.description: Unitary matrix describing flavor-changing weak interactions in the quark sector; parameterized by three mixing angles and one CP-violating phase.

concepts.label: group theoretical constraint
concepts.description: Selection rule or coupling formula derived from representation theory that restricts or determines Yukawa matrix entries and mixing parameters.

concepts.label: lepton sector
concepts.description: Weak isospin doublets (νₑ, e⁻), (νμ, μ⁻), (ντ, τ⁻) and their mass eigenstates; governed by PMNS mixing matrix.

concepts.label: quark sector
concepts.description: Weak isospin doublets (u, d'), (c, s'), (t, b') involving up and down type quarks; governed by CKM mixing matrix.

concepts.label: mixing angle
concepts.description: Parameter of the CKM or PMNS mixing matrix quantifying flavor-changing transitions; predicted by family symmetry models.

concepts.label: flavor model-building
concepts.description: Theoretical framework using discrete or continuous symmetries to construct predictive models of fermion masses, mixings, and CP violation.

concepts.label: modular symmetry
concepts.description: Discrete symmetry based on modular forms and transformations under SL(2,Z) that constrains Yukawa couplings in string compactifications.

concepts.label: modular form
concepts.description: Holomorphic function on the upper half-plane with specific transformation properties under SL(2,Z) used to construct modular-invariant Lagrangians.

concepts.label: neutrino mass
concepts.description: Mass eigenvalues of neutrino flavor states generated via the Weinberg operator; subject to cosmological bounds from structure formation.

concepts.label: Weinberg operator
concepts.description: Dimension-5 effective operator (L̄L̄H_u H_u) generating small Majorana neutrino masses through lepton-number violation.

concepts.label: residual symmetry
concepts.description: Subgroup of a spontaneously broken gauge or discrete symmetry that remains exact in specific sectors (e.g., Z₂ in mass matrices after modular symmetry breaking).

concepts.label: normal hierarchy
concepts.description: Neutrino mass ordering m₁ < m₂ ≪ m₃ compatible with solar and atmospheric neutrino oscillation data; alternative to inverted hierarchy.

concepts.label: modular transformation
concepts.description: Action of SL(2,Z) group elements on the modular parameter τ (modulus) of the compactified geometry, inducing constraints on physical couplings.

concepts.label: Grand Unified Theory
concepts.description: Framework unifying strong, weak, and electromagnetic forces into a single gauge group at high energy scales.

concepts.label: Pati-Salam model
concepts.description: Unified theory with gauge group SU(4)×SU(2)×SU(2) treating quarks and leptons symmetrically.

concepts.label: Messenger mass splitting
concepts.description: Differentiation of messenger field masses according to GUT representation, modulating GUT-scale Yukawa interactions.

concepts.label: GUT symmetry breaking
concepts.description: Mechanism by which a high-scale unified gauge symmetry reduces to the Standard Model via Higgs vev or flux.

concepts.label: Quark-lepton mass ratio
concepts.description: Prediction of the ratio of up-type quark to charged-lepton Yukawa couplings derived from GUT and discrete symmetry constraints.

concepts.label: pseudoscalar sum rules
concepts.description: QCD sum rule technique applied to pseudoscalar meson correlators, relating hadronic properties to short-distance quark-gluon dynamics via OPE.

concepts.label: eta_c meson
concepts.description: Pseudoscalar charmonium resonance (0^{-+}) with mass ~2.98 GeV, composed of charm quark-antiquark pair in s-wave.

concepts.label: charm quark mass
concepts.description: Fundamental mass parameter of the charm quark; measured in the running mass scheme m_c(m_c) at the charm scale.

concepts.label: gluon condensate
concepts.description: Non-perturbative vacuum expectation value of the gluon field strength operator <G²>, dimension-4 condensate in QCD.

concepts.label: Operator Product Expansion
concepts.description: Systematic expansion of time-ordered products of operators in powers of 1/Q², separating short-distance (perturbative) and long-distance (non-perturbative) contributions.

concepts.label: perturbative QCD
concepts.description: Weak-coupling expansion of QCD correlators and cross-sections in powers of the strong coupling constant α_s.

concepts.label: pseudoscalar correlator
concepts.description: Time-ordered product of pseudoscalar currents; encodes the spectral function and resonance masses via dispersion relations.

concepts.label: 3-loop order
concepts.description: Perturbative expansion to O(α_s²) with three-loop Feynman diagrams; determines precision of perturbative contributions.

concepts.label: higher-twist operators
concepts.description: Operators of dimension D ≥ 6 in the OPE, suppressed by powers of 1/Q² and containing multi-parton or condensate contributions.

concepts.label: factorization model
concepts.description: Framework assuming separation of hard and soft scales; used to estimate higher-twist matrix elements of composite operators.

concepts.label: method of moments
concepts.description: Technique extracting hadron masses and couplings by fitting moments of the correlator (weighted integrals) to Borel-transformed sum rule.

concepts.label: MS-bar scheme
concepts.description: Modified minimal subtraction renormalization scheme; standard choice for running masses and coupling constants in precision QCD.

concepts.label: mass matrix texture
concepts.description: The pattern of zero and nonzero entries in fermion mass matrices, constrained by symmetry selection rules.

concepts.label: neutrino mixing
concepts.description: Unitary transformation relating flavour and mass eigenstates of neutrinos, quantified by the PMNS matrix.

concepts.label: Z_3 symmetry
concepts.description: Cyclic discrete symmetry group of order 3 acting on matter multiplets to constrain mass matrices.

concepts.label: permutation symmetry
concepts.description: Discrete symmetry permuting generations or family indices, used to relate mass matrix elements.

concepts.label: Higgs sector
concepts.description: Collection of scalar fields responsible for electroweak symmetry breaking and generation of fermion masses via Yukawa interactions.

concepts.label: Three-Higgs-doublet model
concepts.description: An extension of the Standard Model with three complex scalar doublets coupling to leptons via distinct Yukawa matrices.

concepts.label: Group representation
concepts.description: Assignment of Higgs doublets and lepton generations to irreducible representations of a discrete symmetry group.

concepts.label: SO(10) unification
concepts.description: Grand Unified Theory embedding the Standard Model gauge group SU(3)×SU(2)×U(1) into a larger SO(10) symmetry group.

concepts.label: unified Higgs sector
concepts.description: Higgs multiplets in a GUT framework transforming under the unified gauge group and enabling symmetry breaking to the Standard Model.

concepts.label: See Saw mechanism
concepts.description: Mechanism generating small Majorana neutrino masses by mixing heavy right-handed neutrinos with light Dirac neutrino states.

concepts.label: Dirac neutrino mass
concepts.description: Standard fermion-type mass term coupling left and right-handed neutrino Weyl spinors.

concepts.label: quartic coupling
concepts.description: Four-body coupling between fermion and Higgs fields contributing to mass generation in SO(10) models.

concepts.label: cubic coupling
concepts.description: Three-body coupling between fermion multiplets and Higgs fields enabling enhanced mass generation via mixing.

concepts.label: matter multiplet
concepts.description: Irreducible representation of SO(10) containing quarks and leptons; 𝟏𝟔-dimensional contains one generation.

concepts.label: electroweak symmetry breaking
concepts.description: Spontaneous breaking of SU(2)_L × U(1)_Y gauge symmetry below the electroweak scale generating Standard Model fermion masses.

concepts.label: Bi-unitary decomposition
concepts.description: Factorization of Yukawa mass matrix as Y = U_L Y_diag U_R†, minimizing redundant parameters by absorbing flavor rotations.

concepts.label: QCD sum rules
concepts.description: Method for calculating hadron properties using dispersion relations with contributions from quark condensates and gluon condensates in the QCD vacuum.

concepts.label: constituent quark model
concepts.description: Phenomenological approach describing hadron properties using effective massive quarks bound by strong interactions.

concepts.label: quark condensate
concepts.description: Non-zero vacuum expectation value of quark-antiquark pairs characterizing chiral symmetry breaking in QCD.

concepts.label: chiral symmetry breaking
concepts.description: Spontaneous breaking of approximate chiral symmetry at the QCD scale, generating constituent quark masses and condensates.

concepts.label: spectral representation
concepts.description: Dispersion-theoretic decomposition of hadron observables into weighted contributions from intermediate states.

concepts.label: constituent quark mass
concepts.description: Effective mass of quarks in the hadron rest frame, arising from gluon interactions and chiral symmetry breaking.

concepts.label: current quark mass
concepts.description: Bare quark mass appearing in the QCD Lagrangian at high energy scales, below constituent mass due to gluon dressing.

concepts.label: leptonic decay constant
concepts.description: Coupling strength characterizing the overlap of a hadron's wave function with its leptonic decay products.

concepts.label: heavy pseudoscalar meson
concepts.description: Bound state of a heavy quark and light antiquark with quantum numbers J^{PC}=0^{-+}, such as D or B mesons.

concepts.label: Feynman diagrams
concepts.description: Graphical representation of perturbative QCD amplitudes for calculating hadron properties in both sum rules and quark models.

concepts.label: smearing function
concepts.description: Weight function in QCD sum rules specifying the energy scale separation between perturbative and non-perturbative contributions.

concepts.label: hadron wave function
concepts.description: Quantum mechanical description of internal structure encoding quark-gluon composition and spatial distribution within a hadron.

concepts.label: dispersion relation
concepts.description: Integral equation relating the real and imaginary parts of hadron correlation functions through causality and analyticity.

concepts.label: CKM/PMNS matrix
concepts.description: Unitary mixing matrices describing quark (CKM) and lepton (PMNS) flavor transitions; their angles and phases are fundamental observables predicted by flavor symmetries.

concepts.label: CP symmetry
concepts.description: Discrete combined charge-parity symmetry that constrains lepton and quark mixing phases beyond residual discrete subgroups.

concepts.label: Scotogenic model
concepts.description: Radiative neutrino mass generation mechanism where dark matter mediates one-loop diagrams producing naturally small neutrino mass.

concepts.label: 2↔3 flavor exchange
concepts.description: Extended symmetry permuting second and third generations; explains certain mass hierarchies and mixing patterns.

concepts.label: universal texture
concepts.description: Unified ansatz where quark and lepton mass matrices obey the same texture rules, implying structural similarity across sectors.

concepts.label: violation parameter
concepts.description: Small perturbative deviation from universal coupling assumption, quantifying deviations in Yukawa couplings across generations.

concepts.label: universal Yukawa coupling
concepts.description: Simplified model assumption that Yukawa coupling strengths are equal across all three quark generations.

concepts.label: CKM phase
concepts.description: Complex phase in the CKM matrix elements responsible for weak-interaction CP violation.

concepts.label: Lepton mass spectrum
concepts.description: Eigenvalues and hierarchies of electron, muon, tau, and neutrino mass matrices arising from Yukawa interactions and radiative mechanisms.

concepts.label: Yukawa hierarchy
concepts.description: Power-law or exponential suppression of Yukawa couplings (e.g. λ_e ≪ λ_μ ≪ λ_τ) explaining observed fermion mass ratios.

concepts.label: Higgs boson decay
concepts.description: Process by which an unstable Higgs boson transitions to lighter particles, studied experimentally to constrain fundamental couplings.

concepts.label: hadronic event shapes
concepts.description: Kinematic distributions of final-state hadrons in collider events, used as observables to extract information about underlying particle physics.

concepts.label: light-quark Yukawa
concepts.description: Yukawa coupling strength of the Higgs boson to light quarks (up, down, strange, charm), which are difficult to measure directly.

concepts.label: lepton collider
concepts.description: High-energy experimental apparatus colliding electrons and positrons to produce particles and study fundamental interactions with well-defined initial conditions.

concepts.label: QCD effects
concepts.description: Quantum Chromodynamic corrections and phenomena arising from the strong force, affecting hadronic decay products and event structure.

concepts.label: U_{e3} mixing angle
concepts.description: Lepton mixing parameter controlling electron-to-tau-3 transitions; small in experiment, constrained by flavor symmetry.

concepts.label: supersymmetric scalar potential
concepts.description: Superpotential and Kähler potential terms determining scalar field dynamics and vacuum structure in SUSY theories.

concepts.label: Higgs field VEV alignment
concepts.description: Geometric pattern of multiple Higgs field vacuum expectation values engineered by discrete symmetry to generate texture-zeros.

concepts.label: top quark pole mass
concepts.description: The invariant mass parameter of the top quark in on-shell renormalization scheme, related to the MSbar mass through QCD perturbation theory.

concepts.label: MSbar mass
concepts.description: The modified minimal subtraction running mass of a quark, defined in the MSbar renormalization scheme.

concepts.label: renormalon divergence
concepts.description: Asymptotic non-convergence of the QCD perturbation series at high orders, limiting the precision of theoretical predictions.

concepts.label: four-loop order
concepts.description: Perturbative QCD calculations including all diagrams with up to four loops, providing the highest-order exact coefficients used in this analysis.

concepts.label: heavy quark mass relation
concepts.description: Theoretical relation connecting pole mass to MSbar mass through QCD running and matching conditions.

concepts.label: ultimate uncertainty
concepts.description: Fundamental theoretical uncertainty in pole mass determination arising from renormalon divergence and higher-order corrections.

concepts.label: bottom quark mass effect
concepts.description: Contribution to the top-quark pole mass from internal bottom quark loop corrections.

concepts.label: five-loop correction
concepts.description: Beyond four-loop QCD corrections estimated to contribute additional uncertainty to the mass relation.

concepts.label: asymptotic behaviour
concepts.description: High-order scaling and divergence properties of the QCD perturbation series expansion.

concepts.label: strong coupling constant
concepts.description: The running gauge coupling αs in QCD, which sets the scale of perturbative corrections.

concepts.label: A₄ family symmetry
concepts.description: Discrete symmetry group of order 12 used to explain fermion mass hierarchies and mixing patterns in the Standard Model.

concepts.label: quark-lepton assignment
concepts.description: Unified classification of quark and lepton representations under a GUT symmetry group, constraining mass matrix structure.

concepts.label: Higgs Yukawa coupling
concepts.description: Coupling strength between the Higgs boson and fermions (quarks and leptons), determining fermion mass generation in the Standard Model.

concepts.label: charm Yukawa
concepts.description: Higgs Yukawa coupling to the charm quark, intermediate between light quarks and top quark in coupling strength.

concepts.label: off-shell probe
concepts.description: Experimental technique using virtual or off-shell Higgs production to constrain Yukawa couplings through indirect kinematic distributions.

concepts.label: triboson final state
concepts.description: Final state containing three massive bosons (W, Z, or Higgs) arising from off-shell Higgs production and decay.

concepts.label: HL-LHC sensitivity
concepts.description: Projected measurement precision for rare or off-shell couplings at the High-Luminosity LHC with 3 ab⁻¹ integrated luminosity.

concepts.label: FCC-hh collider
concepts.description: Proposed 100 TeV proton-proton circular collider offering unprecedented sensitivity to Higgs coupling measurements.

concepts.label: Local mirror symmetry
concepts.description: Mirror symmetry for non-compact toric varieties, relating A-model Gromov-Witten invariants to B-model periods and Yukawa couplings via torus-equivariant geometry.

concepts.label: Gromov-Witten invariant
concepts.description: Enumerative invariant counting genus g pseudo-holomorphic curves in a symplectic manifold satisfying homology constraints; central to A-model string theory.

concepts.label: Mirror map
concepts.description: Isomorphism between A-model and B-model moduli spaces; encodes how flat coordinates on one side relate to periods and Yukawa data on the mirror.

concepts.label: B-model geometry
concepts.description: Topological vertex model on the mirror side encoding periods of differential forms, Picard-Fuchs equations, and Yukawa couplings without direct curve counting.

concepts.label: A-model geometry
concepts.description: Topological string theory on the original symplectic manifold; computes Gromov-Witten invariants and genus expansion via holomorphic discs and instantons.

concepts.label: Genus 1 potential
concepts.description: Generating function for genus 1 Gromov-Witten invariants in A-model or elliptic curve contributions in B-model; higher-genus analogue of rational Yukawa.

concepts.label: Projective bundle
concepts.description: P(E) over a base B where E is a vector bundle; admits both local and global mirror descriptions depending on torus actions.

concepts.label: Antidiagonal action
concepts.description: Torus action on a bundle defined by opposite signs on components, e.g., λ₁ = -λ₂, yielding distinct mirror structure and closed-form Yukawa.

concepts.label: Diagonal action
concepts.description: Torus action on a bundle with identical weights on components, e.g., λ₁ = λ₂; reduces to orbifold or projective bundle mirror geometry.

concepts.label: B-L symmetry
concepts.description: Gauge symmetry combining baryon number and lepton number conservation; can emerge from heterotic compactifications as an accidental global or gauged symmetry.

concepts.label: Monad construction
concepts.description: Method for building holomorphic vector bundles over Calabi-Yau manifolds via extension of sheaves; produces gauge bundles with controlled structure group.

concepts.label: Proton decay
concepts.description: Lepton- and baryon-number violating process mediated by heavy bosons or operators; suppressed in the Standard Model and constrained experimentally to lifetimes >10³⁴ years.

concepts.label: Heterotic string theory
concepts.description: Ten-dimensional string theory with E₈ × E₈ or SO(32) gauge symmetry; compactified on Calabi-Yau 3-folds to produce low-energy gauge theories.

concepts.label: Right-handed neutrino
concepts.description: Singlet fermion under the Standard Model gauge group; required for Type I seesaw mechanism to generate light neutrino masses.

concepts.label: Higgs doublet
concepts.description: SU(2)-doublet scalar field with hypercharge ±1/2; acquires vacuum expectation value to break electroweak symmetry and generate fermion masses.

concepts.label: Dimension-four operator
concepts.description: Four-fermion effective operator of mass dimension four that can mediate rapid proton decay; forbidden in the Standard Model by baryon and lepton number.

concepts.label: non-geometric compactification
concepts.description: String theory compactification that cannot be described by conventional geometric Calabi-Yau manifolds, typically involving non-geometric fluxes and T-duality transformations.

concepts.label: Gepner point
concepts.description: Special point in the moduli space of Calabi-Yau compactifications where the geometry is described by a rational conformal field theory, typically realized via Landau-Ginzburg models.

concepts.label: chiral multiplet
concepts.description: Supersymmetric field multiplet in 2D field theory containing a complex scalar and left-moving Weyl fermion.

concepts.label: twisted chiral multiplet
concepts.description: Supersymmetric multiplet in 2D theories with non-standard (1,0) supersymmetry content; arises in non-geometric and Landau-Ginzburg models.

concepts.label: quantum equivalence
concepts.description: Equivalence between distinct string compactifications at the level of physical observables (spectrum, couplings) despite different geometric descriptions.

concepts.label: A4 flavor symmetry
concepts.description: Discrete non-abelian symmetry group of order 12 acting on lepton flavors to constrain fermion mass matrices and mixing angles.

concepts.label: radiative neutrino mass
concepts.description: Neutrino mass generated at loop level via one-loop (or higher) radiative corrections rather than tree-level mechanism.

concepts.label: flavon potential
concepts.description: Scalar potential governing the dynamics of flavon fields whose VEVs break the discrete flavor symmetry.

concepts.label: lepton flavor violation
concepts.description: Processes like μ→eγ or τ→μγ that violate individual lepton flavor conservation; heavily constrained experimentally.

concepts.label: Higgs diphoton rate
