concepts.description: Decay width of the 125 GeV Higgs boson to two photons; enhanced in models with additional charged scalars or fermions.

concepts.label: quark sector extension
concepts.description: Generalization of the lepton-sector A4 model to include quarks and CKM mixing angles.

concepts.label: renormalizability
concepts.description: Property of a quantum field theory where all infinities can be systematically removed order-by-order in perturbation theory.

concepts.label: A4 symmetry
concepts.description: Alternating group of order 12 used as a discrete family symmetry to predict specific lepton mixing patterns including tri-bimaximal mixing.

concepts.label: S4 symmetry
concepts.description: Symmetric group of order 24 that unifies A4 flavons and predicts trimaximal lepton mixing with controlled higher-order corrections.

concepts.label: trimaximal mixing
concepts.description: A lepton mixing pattern where the second column of the CKM-like mixing matrix is (1,1,1)^T/√3, permitting a potentially large reactor angle.

concepts.label: flavon
concepts.description: A scalar field that transforms under a discrete family symmetry and whose vev breaks that symmetry to predict specific fermion mass and mixing structures.

concepts.label: form dominance
concepts.description: A constraint in family symmetry models in which certain matrix elements vanish or are strongly suppressed, preserving specific phenomenological predictions across energy scales.

concepts.label: leptogenesis
concepts.description: Mechanism generating lepton-antilepton asymmetry in the early universe; in form-dominant models it can be suppressed or absent.

concepts.label: renormalisation group corrections
concepts.description: Higher-order quantum corrections that modify mixing angles and masses when running between high energy symmetry-breaking scale and low energy observables.

concepts.label: mixing sum rule
concepts.description: A predictive relation among lepton mixing angles derived from family symmetry; testable in future neutrino experiments.

concepts.label: neutrino masses
concepts.description: The mass eigenvalues of the three neutrino mass eigenstates, constrained by oscillation data and varying by mechanism of generation.

concepts.label: dimension-three mass term
concepts.description: Explicit mass or coupling term of mass dimension three in the Lagrangian; here, heavy neutrino Majorana masses breaking A₄ softly.

concepts.label: soft symmetry breaking
concepts.description: Explicit breaking of a global symmetry by dimension-three or lower terms that do not spoil renormalisability or naturalness.

concepts.label: triplet representation
concepts.description: Three-dimensional irreducible representation of A₄ symmetry; here assigned to three Higgs doublets.

concepts.label: lepton family
concepts.description: Generation structure of leptons: electron, muon, tau and their associated neutrinos; acts as index for A₄ triplet assignment.

concepts.label: D6 symmetry
concepts.description: Dihedral group of order 12 representing the point group symmetry of the GL=12 Calabi-Yau polytope.

concepts.label: Higgs triplet
concepts.description: Scalar SU(2)_L doublet transforming in the triplet representation of discrete symmetry group A4 or S4.

concepts.label: Representation theory
concepts.description: Mathematical framework for decomposing fields under discrete symmetry groups; determines allowed couplings via Clebsch-Gordan coefficients.

concepts.label: soft supersymmetry breaking
concepts.description: Soft SUSY-breaking terms (masses, couplings, A-terms) at TeV scale that preserve gauge coupling unification while breaking SUSY.

concepts.label: slepton masses
concepts.description: Scalar masses of supersymmetric partners of leptons, constrained by flavor symmetry and supergravity.

concepts.label: A-terms
concepts.description: Trilinear scalar couplings in SUSY Lagrangian controlled by soft SUSY breaking and flavor symmetry representations.

concepts.label: gauge coupling unification
concepts.description: Convergence of three SM gauge couplings at high scale in GUT; preserved by soft SUSY breaking.

concepts.label: supersymmetry breaking scale
concepts.description: Energy scale at which SUSY is spontaneously broken; determines magnitude of soft terms and slepton masses.

concepts.label: model-independent proof
concepts.description: Mathematical demonstration of a result valid for any consistent model without reference to specific Lagrangian details or coupling assignments.

concepts.label: smart buildings
concepts.description: Buildings equipped with distributed energy sources and automated systems for energy management and optimization.

concepts.label: multi-objective optimization
concepts.description: Mathematical optimization approach addressing multiple competing objectives simultaneously to find Pareto-optimal solutions.

concepts.label: distributed renewable energy
concepts.description: Renewable energy generation systems (solar, wind, etc.) integrated locally within or near buildings rather than centralized.

concepts.label: normal-boundary intersection algorithm
concepts.description: Multi-objective optimization algorithm that generates Pareto-optimal solutions by intersecting normal directions with the Pareto frontier.

concepts.label: transfer-retention ratio
concepts.description: Parameter measuring the efficiency of energy transfer and retention in distributed renewable energy systems.

concepts.label: improved normal-boundary intersection algorithm
concepts.description: Enhanced version of NBI incorporating adaptive weight sum, uniform axes adjustment, and Mahalanobis distance methods.

concepts.label: adaptive weight sum
concepts.description: Method for dynamically adjusting weights in weighted-sum aggregation of multiple objectives during optimization.

concepts.label: Mahalanobis distance
concepts.description: Statistical measure of distance between points accounting for correlations between variables in multi-dimensional space.

concepts.label: energy scheduling
concepts.description: Temporal allocation and coordination of energy generation, storage, and consumption in buildings to optimize performance objectives.

concepts.label: equipment costs
concepts.description: Financial expenditures associated with purchase, installation, and maintenance of building energy systems and devices.

concepts.label: power supply costs
concepts.description: Operational costs of energy procurement and distribution to meet building demand.

concepts.label: occupants' comfort
concepts.description: Quality metric representing thermal, acoustic, and environmental conditions satisfying building occupants' preferences.

concepts.label: Pareto frontier
concepts.description: Set of solutions in multi-objective optimization where no objective can be improved without degrading another.

concepts.label: dark matter
concepts.description: Hypothetical non-luminous matter comprising ~85% of matter in the universe, stabilized by conservation laws.

concepts.label: Z2 parity
concepts.description: Discrete Z2 symmetry that ensures stability of dark matter by forbidding decays to standard model particles.

concepts.label: discrete symmetry breaking
concepts.description: Spontaneous loss of discrete symmetry under vacuum expectation value acquisition, reducing symmetry to remnant subgroups.

concepts.label: extended Higgs sector
concepts.description: Beyond-standard-model Higgs structure with multiple doublets or singlets introduced to accommodate symmetry requirements.

concepts.label: relic dark matter density
concepts.description: Abundance of dark matter surviving from early universe, quantified by Ω_DM h² parameter measured by cosmological observations.

concepts.label: indirect detection
concepts.description: Experimental search for dark matter annihilation or decay products (gamma rays, cosmic rays) from galactic regions.

concepts.label: electroweak precision tests
concepts.description: High-precision measurements of electroweak observables constraining extensions of the standard model.

concepts.label: collider searches
concepts.description: Experimental searches at high-energy colliders for new particles or interactions beyond the standard model.

concepts.label: perturbativity
concepts.description: Condition that coupling constants remain sufficiently small to justify perturbative expansion in quantum field theory.

concepts.label: democratic mass matrix
concepts.description: Mass matrix ansatz where all entries are approximately equal, arising naturally from left-right flavor symmetry and explaining why one family is much heavier.

concepts.label: Type II Seesaw
concepts.description: Mechanism for neutrino mass generation via SU(2) triplet Higgs bosons; produces naturally small neutrino masses without right-handed neutrinos.

concepts.label: SUSY
concepts.description: Supersymmetry: symmetry between bosons and fermions that doubles the particle content and stabilizes gauge coupling unification.

concepts.label: lepton flavor
concepts.description: Quantum number distinguishing electron, muon, and tau leptons and their associated neutrinos in the Standard Model.

concepts.label: Hybrid work arrangements
concepts.description: Work patterns combining on-site and remote work, accelerated by COVID-19 pandemic, offering occupants flexibility in location and work modality.

concepts.label: Occupancy-driven building controls
concepts.description: Building system operations that dynamically adjust heating, cooling, and lighting based on real-time occupancy detection and prediction.

concepts.label: District-scale energy simulation
concepts.description: Campus-level computational modeling of energy consumption across multiple buildings using integrated energy analysis tools.

concepts.label: WiFi-based occupancy sensing
concepts.description: Non-intrusive technique for extracting occupancy profiles and temporal patterns from wireless network connection data.

concepts.label: Model calibration
concepts.description: Process of adjusting simulation parameters using measured field data (energy, occupancy) to align predictions with real-world performance.

concepts.label: Space cooling demand
concepts.description: Energy required for thermal conditioning and cooling of buildings in response to internal heat generation and external climate.

concepts.label: Centralized building system operation
concepts.description: Building management approach where HVAC and energy systems are controlled from a central facility according to preset schedules, independent of real-time occupancy.

concepts.label: Occupant absenteeism
concepts.description: Periods when building spaces remain unoccupied due to remote work or absence, creating opportunities for energy reduction.

concepts.label: City Energy Analyst
concepts.description: Open-source district-scale energy modeling platform enabling integrated simulation of building energy performance, renewable systems, and urban thermal dynamics.

concepts.label: Operational technology policy
concepts.description: Management strategies and rules governing the scheduling and responsiveness of building systems to occupancy patterns and external conditions.

concepts.label: Energy impact quantification
concepts.description: Measurement and comparison of energy consumption changes resulting from different operational strategies and building control scenarios.

concepts.label: Campus operations
concepts.description: Day-to-day management of building systems, occupancy patterns, and resource utilization across a multi-building institutional environment.

concepts.label: warped extra dimensions
concepts.description: Randall-Sundrum geometry with exponential metric warp factor enabling TeV-scale physics while maintaining weak-scale gravitational coupling.

concepts.label: Kaluza-Klein gluon
concepts.description: Excited resonance mode of the gluon in extra-dimensional compactifications; tree-level mediator of FCNC and precision observable constraints.

concepts.label: b→sγ decay
concepts.description: Rare quark-level flavor-changing process mediated by penguin diagrams; precision electroweak observable constraining new physics scales.

concepts.label: neutron EDM
concepts.description: Electric dipole moment of the neutron; CP-violating observable extremely sensitive to new physics contributions and constraining flavor structure.

concepts.label: little CP problem
concepts.description: Fine-tuning issue in beyond-Standard-Model physics where new sources of CP violation generically induce large neutron EDM incompatible with observations.

concepts.label: ε'/εK ratio
concepts.description: Observable measuring CP violation in kaon decay; ratio of direct to indirect CP violation strongly constraining beyond-Standard-Model flavor structure.

concepts.label: cross-brane interaction
concepts.description: Flavor-mediated process in warped geometry where particles on different branes interact via bulk-propagating fields like flavons.

concepts.label: T² orbifold
concepts.description: 2-dimensional toroidal compactification with discrete identifications that induce residual symmetries on fixed points.

concepts.label: Fermionic mass hierarchy
concepts.description: Observed exponential spread in fermion masses (e.g. top/electron ≈ 10⁵); unexplained in vanilla SM, explained by discrete symmetry.

concepts.label: SU(3)×U(1) flavor
concepts.description: Continuous flavor symmetry group acting on three fermion generations; breaks via two distinct mechanisms to explain mass hierarchy and mixing.

concepts.label: U(2)×Z₃ subgroup
concepts.description: Low-energy residual symmetry after dynamical breaking of SU(3)×U(1); explains why one fermion family is much heavier than the others.

concepts.label: triplet Higgs
concepts.description: Three copies of Standard Model Higgs doublets transforming as a triplet representation under A₄.

concepts.label: vacuum minima
concepts.description: Stationary points of the scalar potential at which the Higgs fields acquire vacuum expectation values.

concepts.label: oblique corrections
concepts.description: Loop-level contributions to electroweak gauge boson self-energies affecting precision observables.

concepts.label: scalar spectrum
concepts.description: The masses and couplings of scalar particles (Higgs bosons) arising from the enlarged scalar sector.

concepts.label: Z and W decays
concepts.description: Electroweak gauge boson decay channels, modified by contributions from triplet Higgs in A₄ models.

concepts.label: model-independent analysis
concepts.description: Systematic phenomenological study of all vacuum minima without assuming specific coupling hierarchies or textures.

concepts.label: wave function overlap
concepts.description: Mechanism for generating fermion mass hierarchies through exponential suppression of overlap integrals of bulk fermion profiles in warped geometry.

concepts.label: bulk flavons
concepts.description: Scalar fields in the bulk of extra dimensions whose vacuum expectation values spontaneously break A4 symmetry and mediate cross-brane flavor interactions.

concepts.label: Kaluza-Klein modes
concepts.description: Massive resonances arising from compactification of extra dimensions; characteristic mass scale sets bounds from precision electroweak and flavor physics.

concepts.label: cross-brane interactions
concepts.description: Couplings between fields localized on different branes in extra-dimensional models, enabling flavor mixing between spatially separated sectors.

concepts.label: gauge mediated flavor violation
concepts.description: Tree-level flavor violation arising from gauge interactions; absent in models with appropriate discrete symmetries protecting flavor structure.

concepts.label: maximal θ₂₃
concepts.description: Atmospheric mixing angle θ₂₃ ≈ 45° predicted by S₃ symmetry to be maximal in the neutrino sector.

concepts.label: collider phenomenology
concepts.description: Experimental signatures of extended Higgs sector and flavor-violating interactions at high-energy colliders.

concepts.label: continuous flavor symmetry
concepts.description: Abelian or non-abelian continuous global symmetry (e.g., SO(3)_f, SU(3)_f) acting on flavor space, complementary to discrete symmetries.

concepts.label: head detection
concepts.description: Task of localising and identifying human heads in video frames, especially in indoor surveillance scenarios.

concepts.label: indoor video
concepts.description: Video sequences captured in indoor environments such as buildings, characterised by cluttered backgrounds and varied lighting.

concepts.label: occupancy detection
concepts.description: Determination of the presence and count of people in a building space, typically using computer vision methods.

concepts.label: motion information
concepts.description: Temporal cues derived from pixel changes between consecutive frames to identify moving objects.

concepts.label: Pseudo Siamese Network
concepts.description: Neural network architecture that processes dual inputs (current and motion-augmented frames) with shared feature extraction pathways.

concepts.label: pixel-wise difference
concepts.description: Frame differencing technique computing per-pixel intensity variations between adjacent temporal frames to capture motion.

concepts.label: deep learning object detection
concepts.description: Class of neural network methods for localising and classifying objects in images via learned hierarchical features.

concepts.label: background suppression
concepts.description: Technique to reduce or eliminate static and irrelevant background elements in detection pipelines.

concepts.label: small-scale object detection
concepts.description: Challenge of detecting objects with small spatial extent in images, requiring high-resolution feature representations.

concepts.label: pose variation
concepts.description: Diversity in spatial orientation and configuration of object instances (e.g., head rotations and tilts).

concepts.label: adversarial robustness
concepts.description: Model resistance to small perturbations or adversarial attacks; evaluated via perturbation sensitivity tests.

concepts.label: feature extraction
concepts.description: Process of learning and computing discriminative representations from raw input data via neural network layers.

concepts.label: building control system
concepts.description: Automated infrastructure for managing building operations (lighting, HVAC, security) using sensor data and AI models.

concepts.label: Thermo Field Dynamics
concepts.description: Quantum field theory formalism for thermal states using doubling of the Hilbert space and tilde conjugation to construct thermal Green's functions and equilibrium ensembles.

concepts.label: bosonic string
concepts.description: Fundamental extended object in string theory with no fermionic degrees of freedom; quantized via light-cone gauge-fixing in flat spacetime.

concepts.label: light-cone quantization
concepts.description: Gauge-fixing procedure in string theory where two light-like coordinates are used to eliminate negative-norm states and ghosts, yielding 24 transverse modes for bosonic strings.

concepts.label: boundary state
concepts.description: Quantum state in the closed string Hilbert space that encodes the boundary conditions satisfied by open strings attached to a D-brane.

concepts.label: thermal string state
concepts.description: Quantum string state at finite temperature T, constructed via TFD formalism by doubling the Fock space and introducing thermal operators.

concepts.label: string entropy
concepts.description: Thermodynamic entropy of a string system at finite temperature, computed from the density matrix trace after tracing over unobserved degrees of freedom.

concepts.label: Dirichlet boundary condition
concepts.description: Boundary constraint on string worldsheet fields fixing coordinate values at string endpoints; characteristic of D-branes.

concepts.label: thermal D-brane
concepts.description: D-brane system at finite temperature, with thermal fluctuations of the boundary state encoded in the TFD doubled Hilbert space.

concepts.label: Hilbert space doubling
concepts.description: TFD technique introducing a second copy of the physical Hilbert space with tilde-conjugated operators to construct thermal density matrices.

concepts.label: Scalar curvature
concepts.description: Fundamental Riemannian invariant measuring average curvature at a point on a manifold.

concepts.label: Compact Riemannian manifold
concepts.description: A closed, finite-volume Riemannian manifold without boundary equipped with a metric tensor.

concepts.label: Nonnegative scalar curvature
concepts.description: Riemannian manifolds with scalar curvature R ≥ 0 everywhere, a topologically restrictive condition.

concepts.label: Geometric convergence
concepts.description: Limiting behavior of sequences of compact Riemannian manifolds under intrinsic distance metrics.

concepts.label: Limit space
concepts.description: The limiting metric space obtained as the Gromov-Hausdorff limit of a sequence of Riemannian manifolds.

concepts.label: Compactness conjecture
concepts.description: Conjecture that sequences of compact Riemannian manifolds with uniform geometric bounds admit convergent subsequences.

concepts.label: Geometric stability
concepts.description: Property that geometric structure is robust under small perturbations or continuous deformations.

concepts.label: Gromov-Hausdorff distance
concepts.description: Metric on the space of compact metric spaces measuring distortion between isometric embeddings.

concepts.label: thermal effective potential
concepts.description: One-loop effective potential arising from finite-temperature string theory on a circle with free action, lifting moduli fields.

concepts.label: finite-temperature string theory
concepts.description: String compactification at non-zero temperature T, implemented by a free action on the Euclidean time circle in the worldsheet.

concepts.label: conifold singularity
concepts.description: A nodal singularity in Calabi-Yau geometry where a three-cycle shrinks to zero size, enhancing the gauge group and triggering BPS state transitions.

concepts.label: gauge theory engineering
concepts.description: Geometric construction of 4D gauge theories from singularities in Calabi-Yau compactifications, where vanishing cycles determine gauge content.

concepts.label: hypermultiplet moduli
concepts.description: Scalar fields in N=2 supergravity charged under gauge symmetries; in CY compactifications they parametrize matter representations.

concepts.label: vector multiplet moduli space
concepts.description: The space of scalar fields in N=2 vector multiplets; its dimension equals the rank of the gauge group in geometric engineering.

concepts.label: heterotic string duality
concepts.description: Duality relating type IIA string on CY3 to heterotic string on K3×T², exchanging Kahler and complex structure moduli.

concepts.label: Swampland cobordism conjecture
concepts.description: Quantum gravity consistency condition constraining the allowed discrete symmetries and topological structures in effective field theories from string theory.

concepts.label: Kreuzer-Skarke database
concepts.description: Complete classification of 473.8 million reflexive lattice polytopes in four dimensions; principal source of Calabi-Yau threefold geometries.

concepts.label: moduli space of cubic surfaces
concepts.description: The parameter space classifying complex cubic surfaces up to isomorphism, a fundamental object in algebraic geometry.

concepts.label: ball quotient model
concepts.description: A compactification of a symmetric space obtained as a quotient of the complex ball by a discrete group action.

concepts.label: toroidal compactification
concepts.description: A smooth compactification of a locally symmetric variety using toric geometry and fan structures.

concepts.label: cone of effective divisors
concepts.description: The convex cone generated by divisor classes that can be represented by an effective (nonnegative) divisor.

concepts.label: nef cone
concepts.description: The convex cone of divisor classes with nonnegative intersection with all curve classes, the dual of the effective cone.

concepts.label: moduli space of real binary quintics
concepts.description: Parameter space classifying smooth and stable real binary quintic polynomials up to equivalence, decomposed into connected components.

concepts.label: real hyperbolic plane
concepts.description: Two-dimensional Riemannian manifold of constant negative curvature −1, the universal cover for hyperbolic orbifolds.

concepts.label: arithmetic quotient
concepts.description: Quotient of a symmetric space by an arithmetic subgroup, endowing it with a natural orbifold structure and measure.

concepts.label: hyperbolic orbifold structure
concepts.description: Complete Riemannian orbifold with constant negative curvature, obtained as a quotient of the real hyperbolic plane by a discrete group.

concepts.label: non-arithmetic triangle group
concepts.description: Triangle group whose defining matrix does not lie in any arithmetic lattice of PSL(2,ℝ), arising from transcendental angle ratios.

concepts.label: smooth real binary quintic
concepts.description: Real degree-5 homogeneous polynomial in two variables with distinct roots and no repeated factors.

concepts.label: stable real binary quintic
concepts.description: Real binary quintic singularity or degenerate form that lies in the closure of the smooth locus within the compactified moduli space.

concepts.label: connected component
concepts.description: Maximal connected subset of a topological space, partitioning the space into disjoint open sets.

concepts.label: induced metric
concepts.description: Riemannian metric on a submanifold inherited from the ambient space via pullback of the metric tensor.

concepts.label: real moduli
concepts.description: Parameters and spaces that classify geometric objects defined over the real numbers, preserving real structure.

concepts.label: wall crossing
concepts.description: Discontinuous jump in the stability of BPS states or vacuum configurations as a parameter (moduli vev) crosses a critical value in moduli space.

concepts.label: vacuum stability
concepts.description: Property of a vacuum configuration ensuring it is a local or global minimum of the effective potential and maintains consistency under small perturbations.

concepts.label: heterotic orbifold string
concepts.description: String theory compactification using E₈×E₈ heterotic strings on orbifold quotient spaces, yielding low-energy effective field theories with gauge groups and matter content resembling the MSSM.

concepts.label: hidden gauge sector
concepts.description: Non-Abelian gauge group coupled only gravitationally to the observable sector, capable of generating non-perturbative superpotentials and driving SUSY breaking.

concepts.label: mini-landscape models
concepts.description: Class of heterotic orbifold constructions yielding low-energy spectra and couplings phenomenologically similar to the MSSM.

concepts.label: MSSM spectrum
concepts.description: The set of particle states and quantum numbers in the Minimal Supersymmetric Standard Model, including quarks, leptons, Higgs bosons, and their superpartners.

concepts.label: constant scalar curvature Kähler metric
concepts.description: A Kähler metric whose scalar curvature is constant across the surface, representing a geometric extremum in the moduli space of Kähler metrics.

concepts.label: foldable surface
concepts.description: A smooth toric surface whose lattice automorphism group contains a non-trivial cyclic subgroup, enabling geometric folding symmetries.

concepts.label: polarized cscK surface
concepts.description: A smooth toric surface equipped with a constant scalar curvature Kähler metric and a polarization (ample line bundle).

concepts.label: K-moduli
concepts.description: The moduli space of Kähler geometric structures, often studied via K-stability and related invariants.

concepts.label: terminal singularities
concepts.description: Mildly singular points on algebraic varieties that arise as quotient singularities and satisfy discrepancy conditions from minimal model theory.

concepts.label: toric affine variety
concepts.description: An affine variety with a torus action defined by combinatorial data, often arising as quotients or base spaces in toric geometry.

concepts.label: Kähler metric
concepts.description: A Riemannian metric on a complex manifold compatible with the complex structure, fundamental to Kähler geometry.

concepts.label: cyclic subgroup
concepts.description: A subgroup generated by a single element, having cyclic structure with finite or infinite order.

concepts.label: GIT quotient
concepts.description: Quotient space of a variety by a group action constructed via geometric invariant theory, used to parameterize moduli spaces.

concepts.label: Symmetry Breaking Predicate
concepts.description: Ordering constraint imposed on assignments within the same symmetry class to allow only one or a small subset as valid solutions.

concepts.label: SAT solving
concepts.description: Computational problem of determining satisfiability of Boolean formulas; core technique for deciding logical constraints.

concepts.label: SAT Modulo Theories
concepts.description: Extension of SAT solving combining Boolean constraints with theory operations over non-Boolean variables such as integers, reals, or algebraic structures.

concepts.label: Theory solver
concepts.description: Component of SMT solver responsible for checking satisfiability of constraints in a specific logical theory beyond propositional logic.

concepts.label: Boolean skeleton variables
concepts.description: Placeholder variables in SMT representing abstract theory operations; can be assigned Boolean values for symmetry breaking purposes.

concepts.label: Symmetry class
concepts.description: Equivalence class of assignments that are indistinguishable under the symmetry group action on formula variables and clauses.

concepts.label: Search space reduction
concepts.description: Pruning of the solution search tree by eliminating symmetric or redundant branches, improving solver efficiency.

concepts.label: CVC4 solver
concepts.description: State-of-the-art SMT solver combining SAT and theory solving techniques; platform for implementing symmetry breaking in SMT.

concepts.label: SMT benchmark
concepts.description: Standardized test suite (e.g., QF_NIA category) for evaluating performance of SMT solvers on constraint satisfaction problems.

concepts.label: Formula symmetry
concepts.description: Structural property where permutations of variables or clauses leave the satisfiability status of a Boolean formula invariant.

concepts.label: Topological defects
concepts.description: Stable, localized excitations in field configurations that cannot be continuously deformed to the vacuum state due to topological obstructions; their existence is protected by homotopy group structure.

concepts.label: Vacuum manifold
concepts.description: The space of degenerate ground states of a system after symmetry breaking, parameterized by order parameters and characterized by its topology.

concepts.label: Phase transitions
concepts.description: Abrupt changes in macroscopic properties of matter as external parameters cross critical values, often accompanied by symmetry breaking.

concepts.label: Condensed matter analogue
concepts.description: An experimental or theoretical system in condensed matter physics designed to mimic cosmological or quantum field theory phenomena such as defect formation.

concepts.label: Quantum field theory
concepts.description: Theoretical framework combining quantum mechanics and special relativity describing particles as quantized fields; the natural context for cosmological and condensed-matter phase transitions.

concepts.label: Topological protection
concepts.description: Mechanism by which topological defects remain stable against small perturbations because their annihilation would require a path through configurations with higher energy or excluded by topology.

concepts.label: Graphene
concepts.description: Two-dimensional carbon allotrope with hexagonal lattice structure exhibiting relativistic Dirac fermion physics at low energies.

concepts.label: Dirac fermions
concepts.description: Massless relativistic quasiparticles with linear energy-momentum dispersion in condensed matter systems, characterized by opposite chiralities at valleys K and K'.

concepts.label: Kekulé ordering
concepts.description: Periodic modulation of graphene's carbon-carbon bond pattern breaking translational symmetry and inducing Kekulé-type lattice distortion.

concepts.label: Gap opening
concepts.description: Opening of an energy band gap at the Dirac point, removing the gapless character of pristine graphene and generating a mass term for quasiparticles.

concepts.label: Dirac point
concepts.description: Unique point in the Brillouin zone where valence and conduction bands touch linearly in graphene, hosting the low-energy Dirac fermion physics.

concepts.label: Valley degeneracy
concepts.description: Equivalence of electronic properties at distinct crystal momentum points K and K' in graphene, related by time-reversal and particle-hole symmetry.

concepts.label: Chirality mixing
concepts.description: Quantum mechanical coupling between opposite chirality states of Dirac fermions near the band gap edge, breaking the independent valley character.

concepts.label: Li intercalation
concepts.description: Insertion of lithium atoms between graphene layers to dope the system and stabilize symmetry-breaking phases.

concepts.label: Dynamical mass generation
concepts.description: Mechanism in particle physics and condensed matter where massless fermions acquire an effective mass through interaction-driven symmetry breaking.

concepts.label: Spectroscopic measurement
concepts.description: Experimental technique probing the electronic density of states and energy dispersion to detect band structure modifications and gap opening.

concepts.label: Microscopic measurement
concepts.description: Spatial-resolution experimental characterization of local electronic and structural properties using scanning probe or atomic-scale imaging.

concepts.label: quantum monitoring
concepts.description: Continuous measurement-based probing of quantum systems that acquires information about observable properties.

concepts.label: measurement back-action
concepts.description: Dynamical effect on the quantum system induced by the measurement process itself, feeding back into system evolution.

concepts.label: domain structure
concepts.description: Spatial pattern of regions characterized by distinct vacuum expectation values or broken-symmetry phases.

concepts.label: Hamiltonian dynamics
concepts.description: Time evolution of a quantum system governed by a Hermitian operator (Hamiltonian) defining the energy.

concepts.label: quantum state
concepts.description: Complete description of a quantum system encoding all probabilistic information about measurement outcomes.

concepts.label: information acquisition
concepts.description: Process by which quantum measurements extract classical information about system observables.

concepts.label: observable
concepts.description: Hermitian operator representing a measurable physical quantity whose eigenvalues are experimental outcomes.

concepts.label: Strong dynamics
concepts.description: Non-perturbative dynamics of a strongly interacting gauge sector at TeV scale, an alternative to the elementary Higgs mechanism for breaking electroweak symmetry.

concepts.label: Technicolor
concepts.description: Composite Higgs model in which the Higgs is a pseudo-Goldstone boson from spontaneous breaking of a new strong gauge symmetry at TeV scale.

concepts.label: Heavy Higgs resonance
concepts.description: Spin-0 composite resonance at mass scale significantly above the electroweak scale, arising as an excitation in strong dynamics models.

concepts.label: Vector resonance
concepts.description: Spin-1 composite state (technirho or analogous) produced in strong dynamics, coupling to Standard Model gauge bosons and fermions.

concepts.label: Gauge boson scattering
concepts.description: Scattering processes of W and Z bosons or photons, sensitive to the structure of electroweak symmetry breaking at high energy.

concepts.label: TeV scale physics
concepts.description: New physics phenomena occurring at energy scales of order 1 TeV, accessible to current and future collider experiments.

concepts.label: Non-linear Schrödinger equation
concepts.description: Quantum integrable system describing N-component fields with nonlinear interaction, solved via the inverse scattering method.

concepts.label: Quantum inverse scattering method
concepts.description: Technique for constructing exact solutions of integrable quantum systems using Yang-Baxter equations and R-matrices.

concepts.label: Reflection-Transmission algebra
concepts.description: Algebraic structure generated by reflection and transmission operators at a defect, encoding the scattering properties of quantum fields across a discontinuity.

concepts.label: Defect
concepts.description: A localized impurity or boundary discontinuity at the origin that breaks translational symmetry and induces new boundary conditions on quantum fields.

concepts.label: Reflection matrix
concepts.description: Unitary matrix R encoding the reflection amplitude of fields scattered from the defect, satisfying the reflection Yang-Baxter equation.

concepts.label: Transmission matrix
concepts.description: Unitary matrix T encoding the transmission amplitude of fields passing through the defect, related to reflection by defect scattering unitarity.

concepts.label: Boundary conditions
concepts.description: Constraints imposed on canonical fields at the defect location, determined by the admissible reflection and transmission matrices.

concepts.label: Unbroken symmetry generators
concepts.description: Subset of symmetry generators that commute with the ground state or defect Hamiltonian, forming the unbroken symmetry subalgebra after symmetry breaking.

concepts.label: Defect subalgebra
concepts.description: The algebra generated by reflection and transmission defect generators, providing the complete symmetry structure of the system with a defect.

concepts.label: Yang-Baxter equation
concepts.description: Fundamental consistency condition for R-matrices and reflection/transmission operators ensuring integrability and exact solvability.

concepts.label: Integrable system
concepts.description: Quantum system with sufficient conserved quantities (Lax pairs, transfer matrices) to allow exact analytic solution via inverse scattering.

concepts.label: superfluid 3He
concepts.description: A quantum liquid phase of helium-3 atoms exhibiting zero viscosity and superfluidity below the superfluid transition temperature, supporting exotic collective excitations.

concepts.label: B-phase
concepts.description: One of two thermodynamically stable superfluid phases of 3He at low temperatures, characterized by a specific internal order parameter structure.

concepts.label: transverse sound
concepts.description: Propagating shear wave mode in which particle displacement oscillates perpendicular to the direction of wave propagation.

concepts.label: collective mode dynamics
concepts.description: Coherent oscillations of many particles in a condensed system, arising from the interaction of individual excitations with the quantum order parameter.

concepts.label: magneto-acoustic rotation
concepts.description: Rotation of the polarization direction of acoustic waves in a magnetic field, used to detect and characterize superfluid collective modes.

concepts.label: 3He polarization
concepts.description: Net alignment of nuclear spins in liquid 3He under application of an external magnetic field, measurable through acoustic rotation.

concepts.label: low-temperature excitations
concepts.description: Quasiparticles and collective modes with energies above the ground state at temperatures well below the superfluid transition.

concepts.label: Nambu-Goldstone bosons
concepts.description: Massless excitations that emerge when a continuous global symmetry is spontaneously broken, corresponding to fluctuations in the order parameter.

concepts.label: Wess-Zumino term
concepts.description: A topological term in the effective action of Nambu-Goldstone bosons that encodes anomalous properties and ensures consistency of the low-energy theory.

concepts.label: fundamental fermions
concepts.description: Fermionic matter fields in the fundamental representation of the gauge group, coupled minimally to the gauge connection.

concepts.label: monopole condensation
concepts.description: Phenomenon where monopoles (topological defects in gauge theory) condense to form a non-trivial vacuum expectation value, affecting the infrared behaviour of the theory.

concepts.label: confinement
concepts.description: Mechanism by which colour-charged objects cannot be isolated; colour singlet bound states form and the potential between separated charges grows linearly with distance.

concepts.label: quark mass range
concepts.description: The interval of fundamental fermion masses over which a specific phase of the gauge theory is realised, determining the vacuum structure and symmetry breaking pattern.

concepts.label: infrared dynamics
concepts.description: The long-wavelength, low-energy behaviour of a quantum field theory, including fixed points, phase transitions, and emergent symmetries.

concepts.label: duality
concepts.description: An equivalence between two different quantum field theories with different descriptions (e.g. gauge-dual or Seiberg-dual) that produce identical physical observables.

concepts.label: flavour number
concepts.description: The count of fundamental fermion species or families in the theory; a dimensionless parameter controlling the strength of quantum effects.

concepts.label: scalar dual theory
concepts.description: An alternative low-energy effective description of the same physics using scalar fields instead of gauge fields, related by duality.

concepts.label: anomalous U(1) gauge symmetry
concepts.description: A U(1) gauge symmetry with a non-vanishing anomaly coefficient that requires Green-Schwarz mechanism for cancellation in consistent effective field theory.

concepts.label: Green-Schwarz mechanism
concepts.description: Anomaly cancellation mechanism in string theory using a modulus-axion multiplet to absorb the U(1) anomaly through coupling to the four-dimensional dilaton.

concepts.label: KKLT stabilization
concepts.description: Moduli stabilization mechanism combining fluxes, non-perturbative effects, and anti-branes to achieve de Sitter vacua in type IIB string theory.

concepts.label: mirage mediation
concepts.description: Pattern of superparticle masses at low energy where multiple mediation mechanisms (anomaly, gauge, GS modulus) contribute comparably, producing characteristic mass ratios.

concepts.label: D-term potential
concepts.description: Scalar potential arising from D-term constraints in supersymmetric gauge theory, proportional to the square of the gauge coupling and field vev.

concepts.label: de Sitter vacuum
concepts.description: Four-dimensional vacuum state with positive cosmological constant, required for cosmic acceleration and uplifting from anti de Sitter geometries.

concepts.label: anti-brane
concepts.description: Anti-parallel brane-antibrane pair carrying opposite tension and charge, used in KKLT construction for dynamical uplifting of the vacuum.

concepts.label: gravitino mass
concepts.description: Mass scale of the fermionic superpartner of the graviton, related to the supersymmetry breaking scale through the supergravity coupling.

concepts.label: modulus-axion multiplet
concepts.description: Chiral supermultiplet containing both the complex dilaton modulus and its axion partner, responsible for carrying anomaly via Green-Schwarz coupling.

It is well known that a theory with explicit Lorentz violation is not invariant under diffeomorphisms.
There are alternative transformations...that can be regarded as a set of improved diffeomorphisms. These symmetries are known as local translations.
Local translations can be best defined within the first-order formalism.
Local translations are Lorentz covariant off shell.
Using a robust algorithm, it is shown that local translations are not a symmetry of the theory [with explicit Lorentz violation].
An example of such a theory, known as the minimal gravity sector of the Standard Model Extension, is analyzed.
It remains to be seen if local translations are spontaneously broken under spontaneous Lorentz violation.
Spontaneous Lorentz violation is regarded as a more natural alternative when spacetime is dynamic.
For geometrical theories of gravity, there are alternative transformations which can be best defined within the first-order formalism...known as local translations.
These symmetries are best defined within the first-order formalism applied to geometrical theories of gravity.
Matrix elements of operators transforming as irreducible representations are governed by Wigner-Eckart relations.
Spontaneous symmetry breaking gives rise to massless Goldstone bosons as fundamental consequence.
Corrections to Wigner-Eckart relations arise when symmetry is spontaneously broken in infinitely-extended systems.
Symmetry breaking Ward identities provide the corrections to Wigner-Eckart relations.
Corrections to Wigner-Eckart relations reduce to a tadpole term involving Goldstone bosons via Ward identities.
Tadpole term involves Goldstone bosons in the spontaneous symmetry breaking case.
When explicit symmetry breaking term is present, tadpole term involves pseudo-Goldstone bosons instead.
Pseudo-Goldstone bosons appear in tadpole terms under explicit symmetry breaking.
Analysis applies to infinitely-extended systems where spontaneous symmetry breaking becomes well-defined.
Wigner-Eckart relations govern matrix elements of operators transforming under symmetry groups.
Irreducible representations are fundamental objects of symmetry groups.
Symmetry breaking Ward identities derive from spontaneously broken symmetries in infinitely-extended systems.
The main procedure constructs log Calabi-Yau compactifications of weak Landau-Ginzburg models (Abstract).
Landau-Ginzburg models are constructed from Fano varieties; the paper applies the procedure to del Pezzo surfaces and coverings of projective spaces.
Del Pezzo surfaces are two-dimensional Fano varieties with ample anticanonical bundle.
For coverings of degree greater than 2, the log CY compactification is singular; the number of fiber components equals the dimension of the anticanonical system.
The dimension of the anticanonical system determines the structure of Fano varieties and their compactifications.
The conjecture states that the number of components of the fiber over infinity equals the dimension of the anticanonical system.
The procedure is applied to coverings of projective spaces of index one to construct log CY compactifications.
For coverings of degree greater than 2, the index-one condition interacts with degree to produce singular compactifications without smooth lifts.
Mirror symmetry is fundamentally a duality exchanging Hodge numbers and geometric invariants between paired varieties.
Log CY compactifications of Landau-Ginzburg models provide a framework for constructing mirror pairs in mirror symmetry.
Discrete automorphism groups constrain the structure of Fano varieties and affect Yukawa selection rules in physical applications.
Spontaneous breaking of diffeomorphism symmetry is examined as the central physical scenario; the action is symmetric but the vacuum is not.
SSB framework naturally accommodates simultaneous local Lorentz-symmetry breaking in the spacetime context.
Conservation laws are derived from diffeomorphism symmetry via Noether's theorem and used as constraints on the action expansion.
Conservation laws serve as constraints on a generic series of terms in the expansion around flat background, determining allowed cubic order terms.
Cubic order expansion explicitly includes metric and tensor field fluctuations; all cubic terms computed for these fields.
All cubic-order terms for a two-tensor coupling to metric are systematically enumerated as the main result.
Perturbative expansion of metric and tensor fields occurs around flat (Minkowski) background geometry.
EFT systematically organizes operators by dimension; the cubic-order terms constitute the lowest-order interaction sector beyond quadratic.
Key result: if diffeomorphism symmetry is preserved in SSB scenario, two-tensor fluctuations cannot decouple from metric fluctuations except in special quadratic cases.
Field decoupling is possible only in special cases of quadratic actions; interactions at cubic and higher orders prevent decoupling.
Results are presented in a form that can be used for phenomenological calculations; explicit cubic-order terms are essential for predictions.
Two-tensor coupling provides a concrete realization of mechanisms for local Lorentz-symmetry breaking in the effective action.
Mirror symmetry relates pairs of CY3 by exchanging h^{2,1} and h^{1,1}; fundamental duality in CY geometry.
IVHS is a parameterized family of Hodge structures satisfying integrality and Picard-Fuchs constraints.
One-parameter families of CY3 are deformations parameterized by a single variable over the thrice-punctured sphere.
ℙ¹ minus three points serves as the base space for one-parameter families with maximal monodromy structure.
h^{2,1} counts complex structure deformations of CY3; with b^3=4, h^{2,1}=1 constrains one-parameter families.
Core problem addressed: classifying IVHS and determining which can be realized by explicit CY families.
Mirror symmetry constrains integral Hodge structure variations through exchange of complex/Kähler moduli.

LVS moduli stabilization applies to CY geometries; GL=12 polytope achieves τ_Swiss ≈ 8.3 for viable LVS background.

Non-perturbative corrections fill Yukawa matrix entries forbidden by discrete flavor symmetry at perturbative level.
SYZ mirror symmetry is a geometric construction specifically developed for compact toric and toric CY varieties (abstract).
Toric CY manifolds are combinatorially indexed by reflexive polytopes in the Kreuzer-Skarke database.
Reflexive polytopes possess automorphism groups; the GL=12 polytope has maximal discrete symmetry D₆.
D₆-invariant Kähler moduli τ₁…τ₅ form a symmetric subset of 17 total moduli under D₆ action.
5 D₆-invariant complex structure moduli emerge as the symmetric subspace of 20 total moduli.

A theory in de Sitter space becomes a theory in Minkowski space in the formal limit when the radius of de Sitter space tends to infinity
Particles considered elementary in standard theory are bound states of two Dirac singletons within the Flato-Fronsdal approach
Dirac singletons are elementary representations of the anti-de Sitter algebra with defining algebraic properties

At quantum level, answers to approximate symmetry questions must be given in terms of quantum concepts rather than classical geometry

Composite particles formed from Dirac singletons exhibit Poincaré symmetry as approximate symmetry in the limit

Projective collineations leave the geodesic structure invariant, maintaining the set of geodesic trajectories.
Decomposable spacetimes are special cases of Riemannian manifolds with product metric structure.
The paper proves that projective collineations of decomposable spaces are equivalent to Lie point symmetries of geodesic equations on subspaces.
Decomposable spacetimes are characterized by direct product decomposition of lower-dimensional submanifolds.
Lie point symmetries are generated by vector fields acting on the spacetime manifold.
Projective collineations are a specific type of spacetime collineation preserving geodesic structure.
Geodesic equations are canonically formulated with respect to affine parameters.
Lie point symmetries are transformations that leave differential equations invariant.
The decomposable structure of spacetimes allows a systematic study of their projective collineations through subspace analysis.

The extended first prolongation prescription constrains infinitesimal generators related to spacetime translations.

The Noether Symmetry Approach selects conserved symmetries to reduce and solve system dynamics.

Viable models in scalar-tensor Gauss-Bonnet gravity are selected by the existence of Noether symmetries.

Selected models are evaluated in cosmological backgrounds where symmetries find exact solutions.

The metric-based asymptotic safety approach breaks general covariance above the gravitational cutoff scale; canonical quantization proves this cannot be maintained quantum mechanically in dimensions >2.
Path integral calculations reveal persistent gauge parameter dependence in quantum gravitational corrections, signaling BRST symmetry violation across multiple independent criteria.
The asymptotic safety program assumes quantum gravity becomes renormalizable through ultraviolet fixed points in metric-based couplings.
Fixed-point properties vary with arbitrary gauge choices; asymptotic safety exhibits persistent gauge parameter dependence rendering physical predictions ambiguous.
Non-convergent truncation schemes extending to 35th order show no approach to stable values, indicating fundamental instability in renormalization group flow.
Asymptotic safety exhibits unitarity challenges through ghost instabilities and propagator negativity violating probability conservation.
Fundamental Wick rotation obstructions prevent reliable connection between Euclidean calculations and physical Lorentzian spacetime in asymptotic safety framework.
Rigorous canonical quantization proves that general covariance cannot be maintained quantum mechanically in dimensions greater than two.
Path integral calculations reveal persistent gauge parameter dependence in quantum gravitational corrections, signaling BRST symmetry violation.
The metric tensor ceases to exist as a valid quantum degree of freedom above the gravitational cutoff scale, rendering metric-based approaches invalid at high energies.
Ghost instabilities and propagator negativity in asymptotic safety violate fundamental unitarity condition of quantum mechanics.
The Unified Standard Model with Emergent Gravity framework systematically avoids all asymptotic safety pathologies by treating gravity as emergent rather than fundamental.
Ultraviolet fixed points are sought in metric-based couplings, but the metric ceases to be valid above gravitational cutoff, making such fixed points physically problematic.
Asymptotic safety exhibits experimental tensions with electroweak precision tests by orders of magnitude, incompatible with Standard Model constraints.
Black hole evaporation is modelled as a process where one symmetry of the system is spontaneously broken continuously.
The sign of one of the free-parameters governs whether particles emitted by the black-hole are fermions or bosons.
Free parameter sign determines whether emitted particles are fermions, enabling selective fermion production.
Free parameter sign determines whether emitted particles are bosons, enabling selective boson production.
Hawking radiation arises due to quantum effects near the event horizon in curved black hole spacetime.
Hawking radiation is a key thermal property of black holes in thermodynamic framework.
The universality of black hole evaporation emerges naturally from spontaneous symmetry breaking mechanism.
Universality of black hole evaporation emerges naturally inside certain modifications of gravity.
Quantum effects near the event horizon are responsible for Hawking radiation production.
Hawking radiation mechanism is central to understanding black hole temperature and entropy.

It is possible to derive from these manifolds the massless spectra of critical string groundstates.
